С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами 12 лет назад он начал свой бизнес куплей продажей скота. Его эффективность помогает ему быть успешным в бизнесе. Он постепенно изучает все аспекты своего бизнеса и его клиенты довольны от его деятельности. У Тоджиддина есть машина, который нуждается в ремонте. Он не в состоянии отремонтировать эту машину и поэтому он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони  для ремонта машины. Этот займ поможет ему восстановить машину и таким образом использовать для нужды семьи. Тоджиддин является повторным клиентом нашей организации и обещает погасить займ во время. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Tojiddin is 29 years old. He is married and is raising four children. His wife Salomat is a very kind woman and a good homemaker. His children are still young and therefore Tojiddin is the only breadwinner in the family. 

In order to provide for the family, he started his own business 12 years ago buying and selling livestock. His efficiency helps him to be successful in his business. He is gradually learning all aspects of his business and his customers are satisfied from his activities. Tojiddin has a car that needs repair. He is unable to repair the car and so he is requesting a loan for 3,000 Somoni for car repairs. This loan will help him restore the car and thus be used for the family's needs. 

Tojiddin is a repeat customer of our organization and promises to repay the loan on time. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ru: Ахмаду 44 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Его жена трудолюбивая женщина и всегда старается помочь Ахмаду для содержания семьи. Она занимается куле продажей продуктов питания. Дети у Ахмада хорошо воспитанные, старшему 18 лет, а младший еще не совершеннолетний. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами 8 лет назад он начал свой бизнес услугой мастера по ремонту автомашин. Он ремонтирует машины марки «Дулан», «Портер», «Газель» и т.п. Его доход хватает на жизнь. У Ахмада есть брат, который имеет очень тяжелую условию проживанию и не имеет постоянную работу. Он хочет уехать за пределы республики, но не имеет денег для покупки авиабилета. Ахмад запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони   для покупки авиабилета для своего брата. Он ждет вашу доброту и обещает погасить займ во время.
texts.en:
Ahmad is 44 years old. He is married with two children. His wife is a hardworking woman and always tries to help Ahmad to support the family. She is engaged in the sale of food products. Ahmad's children are well brought up; the older is 18 years old and the younger is not yet an adult. 

In order to provide the family with all the needed means, he started his own business eight years ago as a car mechanic. He repairs cars of various makes: Doolan, Porter, Gazelle, etc. His income is not enough to live on. Ahmad has a brother who has very difficult living conditions and does not have a full-time job. He wants to go outside of the country (to look for work), but has not money to buy a plane ticket. Ahmad is requesting a loan of 2,500 Somoni to buy a ticket for his brother. He is awaiting your kindness and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy an air ticket for his brother

loans.name: Nazih

texts.en:
Nazih is a 36-year-old Lebanese man. He’s married, living with his wife and two children who are attending school. He and his wife are trying their best to bring added income to the family and enhance their way of living. 

He has been working as a car blacksmith and painter for a few years. He has many years of experience in this domain and has gained a fair number of customers asking for his services.

He wants to enlarge his business and grow his work as well, so he decided to take a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase the needed painting tools and supplies in addition to many other items needed to carry on his work in a proper way.  

Nazih wishes to live a proper life with his family, which is the reason he needs to amplify his income in order to be able to make savings for the future.

loans.use: to purchase painting tools and supplies in addition to many other items.

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
Kassem is a 35-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three children, who are still studying. He’s doing the best he can to satisfy his family's demands and offer them a fair way of living.  

He has been working in the construction field since 1997. He specializes in wall foliage and is waiting for the perfect time to grow in this occupation.

Today, he’s asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase metal scaffolding for his business. This will facilitate his work and allow him to offer his customers a well done job. 

In the future, he plans to open his own wall foliage products shop.

loans.use: to purchase metal scaffolding for his business.

loans.name: Dashgin

texts.en:
Dashgin is 21 years old and single. He is an internally displaced person (someone forced to flee his or her home, but who remains within the country's borders) from the town of Fuzuli. He now lives in the Fuzuli region of Azerbaijan with his brother. 

As a new business, Dashgin breeds cows. He needs 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) to buy calves to improve his new business. Dashgin loves his work.

loans.use: to improve his new business by buying calves.

loans.name: Firudin

texts.en:
Firudin is 50 years old, married and has three children. He has a rented shop where he has been providing tire and repair services for vehicles, etc.

Since he has been in business for more than 23 years, Firudin has accumulated many customers. He is well-known for the good service he provides to his customers. There are many customers who bring their cars to him whenever they are in need of repairs. 

He needs a loan so that he can build a bathroom at his house and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To build a bathroom at his house and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.name: Lean

texts.en:
Lean is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children from Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for several years now. Her husband works as a government employee.

Lean is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and pig feeds. In the future, Lean has hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional pig feeds and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Nowai

texts.en:
Nowai is 45. She resides with her husband and four children in the Kakata community. Nowai stopped her education in the 5th grade. 

She has been working hard for the past eight years in managing her business; she sells rice, palm oil, vita, pepper, salt, onions, tomatoes, etc., at the community market. She sells 11 hours a day, and makes a profit when she sells because of her good relationship with customers. She transports her goods to the market by means of commercial vehicle. 

She thanks the lenders for their support of her business. She is requesting this loan to purchase more pepper, salt, rice and palm oil to increase her sales. She hopes to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, salt, rice and palm oil to increase her sales.

loans.name: Korto

texts.en:
Korto is a resident of Kakata town. She is 34 years old and has two children, ages four and six. The children are in school and live at home. 

For the past fourteen years, Korto has been selling dried goods, such as palm oil, candles, biscuits, and rice. She started this business by selling cold water. One thing she enjoys is that she is always busy and her business is going fast. 

Korto is requesting a loan to purchase palm oil, candles, biscuits, and rice for her business. She plans to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil, candles, biscuits, and rice for her business.

loans.name: Teofana

texts.en:
Teofana is a married woman and a mother of three young children from the town of Panglao, Bohol, Philippines. Her husband works as a fisherman. Teofana and her husband have been in the fishing business for several years now. Teofana is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the boat. With this, her husband will be able to enhance his daily catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Teofana dreams of expanding their business.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the boat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.en:
Leoncia is a woman from Bohol, Philippines. She has a 13-year-old son. Leoncia earns a living through her recycling and scrap-buying business. Leoncia is also engaged in a hog-raising business. 

Leoncia wants to avail a loan to buy more scrap and recyclable materials. 

In the future, Leoncia hopes of making her business a success. Moreover, she aims to explore another venture to augment her income.

loans.use: to buy more scrap and recyclable materials

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is a 41-year-old, secondhand clothes dealer in Bamburi, Mombasa. She is married and her husband provides additional income. She has been in this business for the last 10 years and she is doing great.

Deborah is requesting the sixth loan, after repaying the previous ones successfully, to purchase additional bales of secondhand cloth for resale. She will use the anticipated profit to reinvest in her business. She hopes to own a boutique in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional bales of secondhand cloth for resale

loans.name: Abrahán

texts.es:
En Santa Rosa Del Peñón un bello y encantador municipio donde se dedica a diferente actividades tanto comerciales como la producción de granos básicos, es aquí donde habita el señor Abrahan. 

Abrahán de 41 años de edad quien se dedica a brindar su servicio médico General en uno del puesto del ministerio de salud, ubicada en la comarca más aledaña del municipio. 

Este señor cuenta con 3 hijos bajo su cargo todos estudian uno en la primaria y los otras dos en la secundaria, con lo poco que el gana a duras penas da todo su esfuerzo para que sus hijos estudien y además cubre el sustento de su alimentación diaria en su hogar.

Solicita a Kiva y Ceprodel que le financien un crédito para la compra de medicamento para el bienestar de su salud ya que ha estado presentando mucho problema, por tal razón espera le  financien el crédito.

Son sus sueños más grande llegar a preparar a sus hijo, pero para esto él tiene que contar con una buena salud desea poder comprar su medicamento y mejorar su salud.  

 "Agradezco a Dios como primer instancia por ser el creador de esta organización y por haberme encontrado con ellos en los momentos más difíciles de mi vida porque solo Ceprodel y Kiva, puede financiarme este crédito para una mejor salud".
texts.en:
Abrahan lives and works at various jobs such as growing crops in the beautiful, enchanting city of Santa Rosa Del Peñón. Abrahán is 41 and receives basic medical service at the district health department located closest to the city. He has three dependent children, one in elementary school and two in middle school. He works very hard to earn a small income with which he pays for their education and food. 

He is applying to Kiva and Ceprodel for a loan to buy medicine he needs because he has experienced health problems. He hopes the loan will be approved. His great dream is to educate his children, but he must be healthy and wants to buy his medicine to improve his health. "I thank God that this institution exists and that I found it at a very difficult time in my life, since only Ceprodel y Kiva could provide this loan so that my health improves."

loans.use: to buy medicine.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El Sr. Jose  tiene 24 años y es soltero, se dedica a la venta de artículos de cocina de plástico en su puesto de venta que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Bracamonte, este préstamo es su cuarta secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Jose va a usar este préstamo para la  compra de variedad de artículos de plástico ya que esta época de fin de año tiene mucha demanda de estos productos  y ella quiere surtir su negocio para así ofrecer variedad de artículos a su clientela su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incremento de capital y por ende generar más ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Jose is 24 and single. He sells plastic items for the kitchen from his stand in Bracamonte. This is his fourth loan cycle with the institution, and he will use the loan to buy plastic kitchen items. Since demand for these products is highest at the end of the year, he wants to offer his customers a broad inventory. He is applying for this loan to increase his working capital and, therefore, generate more income.

loans.use: to buy plastic items for the kitchen.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en: Francoise is age 42. She is married with four children. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past three years. With the loan, she wants to buy more sugar, rice and maize flour for resale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice and maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en: Esperance is 35 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has spent two years in this business. With the loan she wants to buy more rice, cooking oil and maize flour for resale. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: To buy more rice, cooking oil and maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 37 years old, married, and lives in Buchanan along with her three children who are between the ages of 1 and 18 years old. Two live at home and attend school, while the younger one is looked after by her grandmother at home. Their father is a contractor. 

Betty runs a table where she sells used shoes in the market, and for the past fourteen years she has been involved in this business. She is requesting a loan to buy used shoes for her business. She hopes to build a house and help all her children in the near future.

loans.use: to buy used shoes for her business.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir lives in his own house with his mother and sister. He is a farmer with 6 years experience. His mother helps him in his business because he also works at government structures and receives a salary. 

He has applied for a loan to buy feed for his animals. In the future, Samir would like to expand his agriculture business, increase the number of animals, and afterwards he will make a wedding for himself.

loans.use: To buy feed for his animals.

loans.name: Joselyne

texts.en: Joselyne is 43 years old. She sells foodstuffs in her store. She has spent 10 years in the business. With the loan, she wants to buy more maize flour, rice, and potatoes for resale. The profits from the business will be used for making more savings.

loans.use: To buy more maize flour, rice and potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Annonciata

texts.en: Annonciata, 44, sells beans and has been in this business for the past five years. With this loan, she wants to buy more beans to sell. She will use the profits from her business to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more beans to sell.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is still a carpenter in Mombasa. He has been in this business for the last nine years and he is doing great. 

He is requesting a second loan to purchase timber for making more furniture. He hopes use the anticipated profit to repay his loan, after successfully repaying the first loan. 

He hopes to own a bigger workshop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase new hammers, nails, timber, and chisels.

loans.name: José Miguel

texts.es:
En el Municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón una preciosa y encantadora ciudad dedicada en diferentes actividades comerciales, donde cuenta con lugares turísticos ubicada en el departamento de León, es donde habita el joven José Miguel de 30 años de edad.

José Miguel se dedica a brindarle enseñanza a estudiante de educación primaria, necesita un financiamiento de Kiva y Ceprodel  para la compra de Cemento, Arena y Pago de Mano de Obra con esto obtendrá uno de sus principales sueños, como es el de reparar su vivienda.
	
Con lo poco que él gana desea mejorar su vivienda y no seguir enfrentando esos problemas que le han ocasionado mucho daño a su familia, pero esto solo se le puede obtener a través de un crédito que le financie kiva y Ceprodel. 

Él cuenta con la esperanza de obtener este tipo de financiamiento de lo contrario seguirá viviendo duras penas con su familia.
"Agradezco a Dios como primera instancia por haberme encontrado con Ceprodel y Kiva, para que estos le brinden mano amigable que tanto necesita y poder vivir en un mejor techo".
texts.en:
José Miguel, 30, lives in the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón, a beautiful and charming city in the department of León with many commercial activities and tourist spots.  José Miguel makes a living teaching elementary school.

He needs a loan from Kiva and CEPRODEL to buy cement and sand, and to pay for labor.  With this he'll achieve one of his main dreams, to repair his house.

With what little he earns he wants to improve his home and not continue facing those problems that have created so much damage for his family.  He can only achieve this, though, with a loan financed by Kiva and CEPRODEL.

He hopes to get this type of financing.  If not, he and his family will continue living with hardships.  "First of all I thank God for having introduced me to CEPRODEL and Kiva so they can lend a friendly hand, which I need so much, and for being able to live in a better house."

loans.use: to buy cement and sand, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Teresa Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el Municipio de Santa Rosa de Peñón  una preciosa ciudad dedicada en diferentes actividades ubicada en el departamento de León, la señora teresa del Carmen es conocida como una persona Responsable Honesta y Trabajadora.

 Teresa del Carmen es una madre soltera cuenta con dos hijos a su cargo, todos estudian, sus principales  funciones es desempeñar el cargo de conserje en uno de los ministerio de salud. 

Teresa del Carmen  mantiene a su familia y asegura que sus hijos vallan a recibir la educación que se merecen, por eso necesita un financiamiento para la compra de una computadora para el beneficio de sus dos hijos quienes necesitan mucho de ella para un mejor aprendizaje, ha descubierto que Kiva y Ceprodel le puede dar este tipo de financiamiento.

De momento solo cuenta con su buena salud, su capacidad de trabajo y la honradez que en el pasado le ha permitido mantener un buen récor crediticio, es por tal razón que solicita a kiva y Ceprodel que le financien este tipo de crédito para cumplir con sus sueños principales de darle una mejor educación a sus hijos ya que en su vida no la pudo obtener.

"Agradece a Dios como primer instancia por haberme encontrado con Ceprodel y Kiva, para que estos le sigan dando la mano amigable para seguir adelante en su vida laboral.
texts.en:
Teresa del Carmen, is known as a responsible, hardworking, and honest person and works at various jobs in Santa Rosa de Peñón, a beautiful city located in León department. She is the single mother of two dependent children who are students. She mainly works as a janitor at a health department. She supports her family and ensures that her children get the education they deserve. She needs a loan to buy a computer so that her children have a better learning experience. She found out that Kiva and Ceprodel provide this financing.

She is healthy, and, given her honesty and ability to work, she has a good credit history. Therefore, she is asking Kiva and Ceprodel to finance this loan so that she can achieve one of her dreams: to give her children a better education than what she had. "Thank God I found Ceprodel and Kiva because they can lend a hand so that I can continue working."

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Oim

texts.ru: Оим очень добрая женщина. Ей 57 лет. Она замужем и имеет 5 детей. Ее муж пенсионер и получает маленькую пенсию. Дети совершеннолетние, но не обеспечивают родителей. С целью получения дохода Оим решила организовать собственный бизнес скотоводством. Она прошла курс «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. После обучения в этом курсе она стала уверенной в себе, что может организовать бизнес и развевать ее. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  1500 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы развевать бизнес. С полученного  дохода он собирается улучшить условия проживания. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Oim is a very kind woman. She is 57 years old. She is married and has five children. Her husband is retired and receives a small pension. His children are grown, but are not able to support their parents. 

WIth the goal of earning income, Oim decided to start her own business raising livestock. She took a course "Bring It On" organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate. After learning in this course, she was confident that she could organize a business and take off. 

She is requesting a loan of 1,500 Somoni to buy livestock to develop a business. With the earned income, she is going to improve her living conditions. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle for organizing new business

loans.name: Mirzosalohiddin

texts.ru: Мирзосалохиддину 18 лет. Он очень умный и трудолюбивый молодой человек. Мирзосалохиддин окончил среднюю школу с отличными оценками. В школе он был одним из лучших учеников. Он участвовал в школьных и городских олимпиадах по математике и физике. Данное время он является студентом 1 курса Политехнического Государственного Университета Таджикистана по специальности экономика и управления предприятий. Он учится отлично и активно участвует во всех мероприятиях университета. После занятий он работает в мебельном магазине. Он работает сборщиком мебели.  Родители простые рабочие, и их доход не позволяет им оплатить за учебу сына.  Мирзосалохиддин запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы в университете. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mirzosalohiddin is 18 years old. He is a very intelligent and hardworking young man. Mirzosalohiddin graduated from high school with honors. In school he was one of the best students. He participated in school and city competitions in mathematics and physics. 

Now, he is a first year student at the Polytechnic State University of Tajikistan with a major in economics and business management. He studies well and is actively involved in all activities of the university. After classes, he works in a furniture store as an assembler. 

His parents are simple workers and their income does not allow them to pay for their son's schooling. Mirzosalohiddin is requesting a loan to pay for his university studies. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.en:
Pelagia is a 68-year-old woman and a resident of Dauis, Bohol. She is engaged in tablea making (cacao chocolate) and polvoron (shortbread cookies) for several years now. This is the source of her income.

Pelagia is asking for a loan to buy flour, sugar, milk and other ingredients for making tablea and polvoron. In the future, she hopes to improve her business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, milk and other ingredients.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 50 years old and married to John, who contributes to the family income. She has been running her butchery for a period of about three years with an income of approximately KES13,000, which she uses to support her family.

She applied for her second loan and she will use it to add more stock of beef for resale. She hopes to be able to open more shops.

loans.use: to buy more beef for resale.

loans.name: Ghulamfatima

texts.en:
Ms Ghulamfatima is a 50-year-old widow. She has had a business of hand embroidery for the past ten years. By this time she has become popular in her vicinity. She beautifully makes embroidery patterns on bed covers and cushions. She makes enough to cover the daily expenses of her children.

She is a mother of three children. Her two daughters also help her in her business. She wants to grow her business. She requested a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy raw materials such as spools of thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to complete the orders on time. She shares her dream of opening a training center to teach embroidery skills to the girls of her community.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as spools of thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to complete her orders on time.

loans.name: Pamela Ann

texts.en:
Pamela Ann is a married woman and the mother of a four-year-old, and she is a resident of Bohol, Philippines. She runs a sari-sari store business and sells different items to the people in her locality.

She is asking for a loan to buy additional items to sell in her store, such as snack food, coffee and beverages, toiletries and others. In the future, Pamela Ann dreams of making her business a success and to save money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her store, such as snack food, coffee and beverages, toiletries and others.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina is a single parent, taking care of six children. She sells provisions such as toffees, milo, powdered milk and others at Elmina, which she has done for 6 years. She wants to add the sale of other types of groceries, and so a loan from Kiva will be used to buy other varieties of groceries to sell.  Her future plan concerning the business is to open another branch in a different village.

loans.use: to buy other varieties of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary, a 36-year-old married mother of  six children between the ages of 6 and 20, lives with her family in Buchanan. She has been selling slippers and rubber dishes (tubs, buckets, plates, spoons, etc.) for the past four years, and is requesting a loan to purchase more such products to sell. Mary hopes to become a homeowner and take care of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers and rubber dishes (tubs, buckets, plates, spoons, etc.) for her business.

loans.name: Brigildo

texts.en:
Brigildo, 49, is a resident of  Baclayon, Bohol. He bakes cakes and pastries and delivers them to his customers and other bakeries for resale.
 
Brigildo is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, margarine, cooking oil, baking powder and flavorings to bake his cakes. With these ingredients, he will be able to bake and sell more cakes, thus increasing his sales and income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, margarine, cooking oil, baking powder and flavorings to bake his cakes.

loans.name: Johnstone

texts.en:
Johnstone is a 64-year-old married man with four children; his spouse runs a farming business which helps in producing some additional income. 

Johnstone runs a timber yard in Baringo County. He has been in business for the last six years. His monthly income from the business is KES 12,000.

He has borrowed his fourth loan of KES 36,000 for a period of one year. He intends to use the loan to purchase more timber to stock his yard and to resell. 

Johnstone plans to use the additional income to plough back into the business and to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase timber for resale.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a 35-year-old farmer in Kitale county in Kenya. He lives with his wife and has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. He produces eggs, milk, and vegetables, which he sells at the local market in his area.

He is requesting a 31,200 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He will be able to earn extra income for his family by selling the cow's milk, which will help him improve his living standards. He aspires to have five dairy cows and be the leading supplier of milk in his area in the next five years. Pests and diseases are his major challenges in farming.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Jayjay

texts.en: Jayjay lives in Buchanan. She is 36 years old and did not go to school. She is married and has seven children between the ages of 7 and 20. Her children attend school and live at home. For 15 years she has been running a restaurant in the local market where she sells delicious Liberian dishes. She started  this  business with money given to her by her mother; she also learned the business from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, bitter ball, okra, and palm oil for her business. Her plans are to buy a piece of land and build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, bitter ball, okra, and palm oil

loans.name: Marcia Argentina

texts.es:
La Señora Marcia Argentina, es madre soltera de ocho hijos, posee un negocio de venta de ropa y zapatos  usados desde hace dieciocho años ubicado en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León sale de su casa a la 6:30 am y abre su negocio a las 7:00 am  cerrándolo  a las 4:00 pm, realiza este trabajo para llevar el sustento de su familia. 

Doña Marcia está solicitando este crédito a Ceprodel  para comprar Pacas de ropa y zapatos de diferente estilo de y mejor calidad, compra su mercadería  en la ciudad de Managua una vez por semana,  ofrece desde muy temprana hora a toda su clientela la variedad de productos  la que atiende con su Hija de 20 años de edad. 

Doña Marcia sueña que con la ganancia obtenida de su negocio  terminar de construir su humilde vivienda para darle una mejor comodidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marcia Argentina is the single mother of eight children. For 18 years, she has sold used clothing and shoes at one of the León markets. She leaves her house at 6:30 am to go to her business, which is open from 7:00 am until 4:00 pm. Her business supports her family. 

Marcia is applying to Ceprodel for a loan to buy quality bulk clothing and shoes of various types. She buys the merchandise in Managua once a week. Early every morning, she and her 20-year-old daughter offer their customers a wide selection. With her profit, Marcia hopes to finish building a small house that will be more comfortable for her children.

loans.use: to buy used clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Marianela

texts.es: La Sra.  Marianela tiene 31 años, tiene un hijito de la edad de 4 años,  ella  se dedica  a la   venta de variedad de ropa de temporada y en esta ocasión se dedica a la variedad de Camperas y pantalones, ella tiene un puesto fijo en uno de los mercados más concurridos de la ciudad de La Paz donde ofrece sus productos a su clientela,  este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra.  Marianela va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de variedad de  de ropa  por mayor y de esta manera brindar variedad de ropa  a su clientela ya que esta época tiene mucha demanda y así de esta manera e incrementar sus ganancias,  Sra.  Marianela es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Marianela is 31 and has a 4-yer-old son. She sells seasonal clothing; at the moment, she is offering jackets and pants. She has a merchandise stand at one of the busiest markets in La Paz. This is her first loan cycle with the institution. 

Marianela will use the loan to buy wholesale clothing to offer her customers a wide selection during the busiest season of the year, which will increase her income. She is hardworking and is happy to have this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Ms. Jamila is a 33–year-old married woman. She has been successfully selling small woods and raw paper in her home for the last year. She offers various kinds of wood for fire and furniture purposes. Due to her business she is well known in her community. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is working as a laborer and earns insufficient income to support his family alone.          

She is a mother of two children. She is motivated to provide for her family. She has been in association with Kashf for the past four years. In order to meet the increasing demand of her customers due to the winter season, she applied for a loan of 20,000 PKR. She will use the loan to purchase more logs of good quality to cater to the demand of her customers. She is hopeful to get an increase in her net income and wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more logs of good quality

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha lives in Buchanan, is 36 years old, was not able to go to school and is now married and the mother of five children who range in age from 7 to 20 years old. They live at home and Martha has helped support them for the last 18 years by selling shoes and slippers in a local market. She started this business with money given to her by her mother and learned the trade from friends. She is requesting a loan to buy more shoes and slippers to sell. Her goal for the future is to build a house for her children to live in.

loans.use: to buy more shoes and slippers to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Koko

texts.en:
Koko, 35, is determined and hardworking. She is a single mother of two children aged 5 and 15. They stay at home with her in Sinkor and are in school. 

For the past eight years, she has been selling oranges, plums, bananas, pineapples, and cucumbers adjacent to the supermarket. Her daily sales are high because as customers go in and out of the supermarket they stop by to purchase one or two items from her. She sells for fourteen hours a day and transports her goods to her business area by a commercial vehicle. She thanks the lenders for empowering her in her business. She is proud of her business because with the profit she buys more goods and pays for her children's education. 

She is requesting this loan to purchase more oranges, plums, pineapples, and cucumbers for her business. Her dream is to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more oranges, plums, pineapples, and cucumbers for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie lives in Ground Bassa County, is 35 years old, married and the mother of five children who range in age from 14 to 17 years old. For the past eight years she has earned a living by selling onions, palm oil, potatoes and rice in the local market. She established the business by using small loans from mother, and is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell to her customers. Her goals for the future are to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more onions, palm oil, potatoes and rice to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena earns a living by selling fruit, maize and gari (or pickled vegetables) in the town of Elmina. To prepare the gari, she buys raw fresh cassavas from the market. She washes and peels them, and then sends them to a mill to be turned into dough. Gari is popular among students and large families. Students eat it often because it is a quick and easy food to prepare. They soak gari with condensed milk and water, and sometimes add peanuts. Some students also prepare gari in the form of dough and eat it with pepper sauce and sardines. A variety of sauces can be served with gari, depending on a family’s preferences, and any kind of meat or fish can be eaten with these soups and sauces.

Abena is married and the mother of four children. Her husband is a farmer, and her income helps the family pay utility bills. She will use this loan to buy a variety of fruit and cassavas to sell.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save for the university education of her children.

loans.use: buy variety of fruit and cassavas to sell.

loans.name: Mahugnon 4 Group

texts.fr: "MAHUGNON 4" est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies et mènent les mêmes activités. La présidente du groupe, Françoise (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 28 ans. Françoise est mariée à un maçon du nom de Toussaint. Le couple a un seul enfant. Françoise vit avec son mari et son enfant. Il y  a environs deux ans que Françoise fait le commerce de savon communément appelé KOGUI(savon fait avec de l'huile rouge et de la soude) par la méthode de distribution. Françoise achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Françoise bénéficie de crédit auprès de ALIDé. Face à la demande de plus en plus croissante de sa clientèle, Françoise ambitionne augmenter son fonds de roulement et rehausser le niveau de son activité, afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle. C'est la raison pour laquelle Françoise sollicite ensemble avec les autres du groupe "MAHUGNON 4" un financement auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group MAHUGNON 4 consists of three friends who practice the same activity. The group’s president is Françoise, seen with her hand raised in the photo. She is 28 years old and married to a mason named Toussaint. They have one child. Françoise lives with her husband and their child.

About two years ago, Françoise started selling a soap called KOGUI (made with red oil and caustic soda) through the distribution system. She buys her supplies at a market in Benin. This is her first loan cycle withe ALIDé. 

With the steady increase of customer demand, Françoise wishes to bolster her working capital and strengthen her activity to better meet the needs of her clientele. 

To that end, Françoise is seeking a loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the group MAHUGNON 4.

loans.use: to buy four jugs of red oil.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, es casada y no tiene hijos dependientes ya que ellos ya tienen sus familias, viven en casa propia, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Senkata    de la ciudad de El Alto.

Ella estudio hasta el nivel primario y actualmente se dedica a la venta al por menor de verduras y papa, en la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo requiere para comprar material de construcción: cemento, ladrillos, fierro. Así podrá levantar un pequeño baño en su casa para la comodidad de ella y de su esposo.

El sueño de Isabel es tener una casa que sea confortable.

Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Isabel is married and has no dependent children, as they already have their own families. They live in their own home in the Senkata area of the city of El Alto.

She went to school as far as primary, and currently sells vegetables and potatoes at retail in the city of El Alto.

She needs the loan to buy construction materials: cement, bricks and rebar. This way she will be able to build a small bathroom in her home for the comfort of her and her husband.

Isabel's dream is to have a home that will be comfortable.

This is the second time she has applied for a loan with IMPRO, and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy bricks, cement, and rebar for building a bathroom in her home.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Ángela de 54 años de edad, está casada con Juan con quien tiene 3 hijos, pero vive solo con uno de ellos. Ellos habitan un hogar propio ubicado en un distrito de la selva central. Con carácter afable y simpático, Ángela cuenta que, gracias a su empeño pudo instalar un pequeño negocio en su propia casa. Empezó hace 8 años, ahora su establecimiento está más surtido y con mayores productos. “Me va bien, lo que más se vende son los abarrotes y las carnes, principalmente la de pollo”, menciona. Para esta actividad tiene que adquirir mercadería cada semana, en caso de alimentos perecibles, y cada mes si se trata de abarrotes y otros.
Por su parte, Juan se dedica  a las labores de albañilería, de esa manera aporta ingresos para el gasto diario de la familia. 
Se siente tranquila con su trabajo, por haber conseguido clientes conocidos y confiables, pero como en todo negocio menciona que cuenta con compradores que llevan sus productos al crédito, y a veces no le pagan. A pesar de ello le va bien. Desea continuar con su negocio, por eso requiere de su apoyo. Éste sería su préstamo número 14 que obtendría de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Heliconias” y se siente a gusto con socias responsables.
Con los 1500 soles podrá comprar  abarrotes como sacos de arroz, de azúcar, bidones de aceite, conservas y leche enlatados, además de verduras y carnes, para expenderlos en su tienda.
texts.en:
Ángela, 54, is married to Juan, with whom she has three children, though only one lives with them. They live in their own home in the central forest. She is kind and friendly, and thanks to hard work, she opened a small business in her house eight years ago. Now the store is better stocked with quality products. “The business is going well. What I sell most are groceries and meats, especially chicken," she says. She buys perishable items every week and groceries and other products every month. Juan works as a bricklayer to earn income to support his family. 

Ángela likes her work and has regular clients. Like every business owner that buys supplies on credit, at times she is not able to pay. Still, her business is a success, and she wants to keep it going but needs help. This is her 14th loan cycle with MFP, and she promises to make her payments on time. She belongs to the communal bank “Las Heliconias,” and she's happy that the members are responsible. With 1500 soles, she will be able to buy groceries such as rice, sugar, drums of oil, jams, canned milk, vegetables, and meats to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, drums of oil, jams, canned milk, vegetables, and meats to stock her store.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Reyna, tiene 61 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, es madre soltera y vive con una de sus hijas y nietos en Taulabe, Comayagua.
Doña Reyna lleva 14 años de tener su propio negocio de elaboración de prendas de vestir, confecciona vestidos, pantalones, faldas, cortinas, sabanas, camisas, uniformes y otros trabajos de reparación de ropa. Anteriormente ella vendía cosméticos y se dedicaba a las labores del hogar. Ahora dedica más tiempo a su taller de costura. Esta solicitando un préstamo de 23,000 Lempiras, siendo este el onceavo ciclo de préstamo con ODEF y lo invertirá en la compra de telas, hilos, agujas, botones y otros materiales que necesita para confeccionar prendas de vestir que le han pedido en esta temporada navideña. Ella tiene como meta a corto plazo con las ganancias arreglar el techo a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Reyna, 61, has two children; she’s a single mother living with one of her daughters and grandchildren in Taulabe, Comayagua.  She’s had her own clothes-making business for 14 years; she makes dresses, pants, skirts, curtains, sheets, shirts, uniforms and does clothing repair.  She used to sell cosmetics and did household chores.  Today, she spends more time in her sewing workshop.  

She’s requesting a 23,000 Lempira loan which will be her 11th ODEF loan cycle and she will use it to buy fabric, thread, needles, buttons and other supplies she needs to make clothes she has on order for the Christmas season.  Her short-term goal is to earn profits to repair her house’s roof.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies like fabric, buttons and needles.

loans.name: Evaste

texts.en: Evaste is 33 years old and a widow. She earns a living by selling beans and clothes, and is requesting a loan to buy more beans to sell to her customers. She plans to use the profits she earns from this loan to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more beans to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is married to a businessman and the mother of four children. She earns a living by selling various items in a store which she has run for the past eight years. She is requesting a loan to buy more salt, soaps and rice to sell. She will use the profits she earns from this loan to renovate her business.

loans.use: to buy more salt, soaps and rice to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es:
Dionisia de 54 años natural de Santa Rosa, casada con Agustín también de 54 años. Ambos tienen el orgullo de haber logrado que sus 4 hijos sean personas trabajadoras y emprendedores. Juntos habitan en una vivienda construida a base de material noble. Por recomendación de sus hermana, decidio incursionar en la venta de helado casero. Pasado ya 30 años, sus helados son de preferecia de la clientela, pues en todo este tiempo han logrado implementarse y ahora su pequeña empresa esta acondicionado de maquinas especiales para la obtención de helado de la mejor calidad. Del mismo modo, su principal materia prima es la fruta de la zona, lo cual le ayuda a que su producto se identifique con la región. Siendo estos repartidos por heladores que ellos proveen, distribuyendo así su produto. En ocasiones, personalmente vende los helados a los transeuntes. Se siente muy contenta por cumplir su compromiso de trabajar por el progreso de su familia.
Ahoa gracias a las ganancias, ha ampliado su casa y también ha comprado dos congeladores más. Pero menciona que necesita de capital para incrementar su producción, ya que al iniciarse la temporada de verano los comercios y servicios en su conjunto presentan un buena salida para beneficio de los comerciantes emprendedores como ella.
Sus deseos a largo plazo apuntan a la apertura de sucursales de producción en otros distritos de su localidad para poder hacer conocida su marca y consolidarse como una gran productora de helados en su localidad. Por tal razón solicita 500 nuevos soles e invertirlo en la compra de insumos, como frutas, y así aprovechar la buena demanda por fin de año.
texts.en:
Dionisia, 54, is from Santa Rosa.  She’s married to Agustin, also 54, and they are proud to have succeeded in that their four children are hardworking entrepreneurs.  They live together in a house built of substantial materials. On her sister’s recommendation, she decided to go into selling home-made ice-cream.  Thirty years later, her ice-cream is preferred by customers because she’s managed to secure her position after all this time and now her small firm is equipped with special machinery to produce the best quality ice-cream.  In addition, her main raw material is regional fruit which helps her product to be identified with the region.  They are distributed by ice-cream sellers they supply themselves selling their products this way.  Sometimes, she sells the ice-cream personally to passersby.  She feels very happy for having met her commitment of working for her family’s progress.

Now, thanks to profits, she’s been able to enlarge her house and has also bought two more freezers.  But she mentions that she needs capital to increase production because when summer starts sales in businesses and services in her area increase benefitting enterprising merchants like her.

Her long-term wish is to open branch production units in other districts so her brand will become well-known and she will become well-established as a local ice-cream manufacturer.  Because of this, she’s asking for 500 new soles to invest in ingredients like fruit to take advantage of end-of-year demand.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruit.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora de 64 años esta casada con Sebastián, con quien tiene 7 hijos pero ellos son mayores de edad. Ella vive con su esposo en una casa propia ubicada en la selva central.
Teodora es una mujer cálida y humanitaria. Cuenta con un puesto de ventas ubicado en un lugar turístico muy visitado. En su establecimiento expende artesanías como pulseras, collares, aretes, adornos para el hogar, etc., todos estos elaborados con semillas de plantas exóticas. “Lo que más se vende son los monitos de coco (artesanía) a 10 soles pero yo lo compro a 5 y gano el doble”, comenta. 
Pero estos meses no tiene muchas ventas, por ello también ofrece gaseosas y refrescos helados. Tiene pensado visitar a sus hijos, en éstas fiestas navideñas y volver con fuerza al trabajo. Además su viaje le servirá para adquirir mercadería de otras ciudades.
Ésta contenta porque confía que estos días serán de mucho provecho familiar y en sus negocios. Éste sería su préstamo número 7 con de MFP gracias a su ayuda, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Heliconias” y le agrada el trabajo en equipo.
Invertirá los 500 soles en la compra de más artesanía al por mayor entre pulseras, collares, adornos caseros, entre otros.
texts.en:
Teodora is 64 years old and is married to Sebastián. They have seven children, but they are adults. She lives with her husband in their own home located in a district in the central jungle.

Teodora is a warm and generous person. She has a stand located at the entrance of a popular tourist spot. In her facility she sells handicrafts such as bracelets, necklaces, earrings, home decorations, etc. All of these are made from the seeds of exotic plants. “What I like best is selling coconut monkeys (crafts) at 10 soles but I buy at 5 and will double the price,” she says. But these months there are not many sales, so she also offers soft drinks and ice cream sodas. 

She has been thinking of visiting her children during the holiday season and returning with vigor to work. Her trip will also be useful in acquiring merchandise from other cities. She is happy because she is confident that these days will do much to benefit her family and business. 

This will be her seventh loan through MFP and she is grateful for the help. She promises to be punctual in her loan repayment. She belongs to the communal bank “Las Heliconias” and she enjoys the teamwork.

She will invest the 500 soles in the purchase of more handicrafts buying at wholesale, including bracelets, necklaces, homemade decorations, among others.

loans.use: to buy bracelets, necklaces, and decorations crafted by hand for her business

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura is 34 years old, married, and a mother of four children from Bohol, Philippines. Maura earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business. She sells different items and commodities to the people in her store. 

Maura wants to avail herself of a loan to buy more stocks to sell in her store, like noodles, soft drinks, and snack foods. With these items, Maura will be able to attract and sell more products, thus increasing her profit and income.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her store, like noodles, soft drinks, and snack foods.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en: Immaculee is 46 years old. She sells locally made beer, which she has been doing for 20 years. Immaculee is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more sorghum to make beer. She plans to save her profits.

loans.use: to purchase sorghum to make local beer.

loans.name: Musy

texts.es:
Musy, de 22 años de edad, es una joven con muchos deseos de salir adelante, trabajadora y empeñosa, es soltera, vive en compañía de sus 02 hermanos, sus padre, su madre, a los quiere mucho y se esfuerza por ser el orgullo de su familia, ahora habitando cómodamente la casa de sus padres. La actividad que realiza Musy es la venta de bebidas gaseosas heladas al por mayor por cajas y por unidades para llevar,  desde la casa de sus padres donde cuenta con una congeladora de regular tamaño, para enfriar sus bebidas y venderlas al gusto de sus clientes, desde hace 01 año donde atiende muy amablemente ella solo y en ocasiones sus hermanos cuando está fuera de casa. Le gusta su negocio ya que le permite tener un ingreso económico para pagar sus gastos personales  y apoyar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar además de la  libertad financiera e independencia, deseando poder convertirse en una prospera empresaria, ahora viendo los buenos resultados que está teniendo. Por lo contrario la competencia aumentado esto la esta obligando a buscar un mejor local comercial para su actividad. Desea continuar con su negocio queriendo ampliarlo e incrementar el volumen de su stock de mercaderías. Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 03 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida con el apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal pues considera  a sus integrantes ser personas amables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de más bebidas a precio por mayor y  así tener mejores ganancias,  de diversas marcas y presentaciones para atender al gusto de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Musy, 22, is a young woman who very much wants to get ahead; she’s hardworking and dedicated.  She’s single and lives wither two siblings, her father and her mother who she loves very much and strives to be her family’s source of pride.  She lives comfortably in her parents’ house.

Musy’s activity is selling cold carbonated beverages to take away at wholesale and by the unit in her parents’ house where she has a regular-size refrigerator to cool her beverages to sell to her customers according to their taste.  She’s been kindly tending to her customers by herself for a year but sometimes when she has to be away from home her siblings help her.  She likes her business because it allows her to earn income to cover her personal expenses and to help her parents with household costs in addition to giving her financial independence; she wants to become a prosperous businesswoman now that she’s seeing the good results she’s getting.

However, competition has increased which is forcing her to find a better location for her commercial activity.  She wants to stay in business and to expand it and increase her volume of stock merchandise which is why this will be her 3rd MFP loan.  She feels grateful for lathe financial support to advance with her business.  She also feels comfortable in her communal bank because she considers the members to be kind, mutually supportive people.

She will use the requested 1,000 new soles to buy more beverages in assorted presentations and of various brands at wholesale in order to earn higher profits and provide for her customers’ taste.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of carbonated beverages.

loans.name: Japheth

texts.en:
Japheth is a 36-year-old farmer in Kitale county in Kenya where he lives with his wife and three children. His children are all in school. Japheth has been in farming for the past five years. He sells eggs and maize at the local market.

Japheth is requesting a 30,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds. The poultry will increase egg production and allow Japheth to earn extra income after selling the eggs. This will help Japheth improve his family's standard of living and pay for his children's schooling. 

Japheth aspires to have two thousand poultry hens and three dairy cows in the next five years. The high cost of poultry feed is his major challenge in farming.

loans.use: to increase egg sales by purchasing poultry birds.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is 28 years old and single. He owns a hardware store, which he has been doing for one year. Jean is requesting a loan, which he will use to add more construction materials in his store. He will save the profits to build a better future for his business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to sell.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 32 years old, married, and has two children.  He owns a welding workshop, which he has been doing for five years.  His monthly income is 25,000 KES. His spouse runs a shop, which helps in producing additional income.

Michael is requesting his second loan for 40,000 KES, which he will use to purchase more stock of welding materials. He plans to use the additional income to invest in his business and to educate his children

loans.use: to purchase welding materials.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
Hernán, es casado y tiene un hijo que está en etapa escolar en un colegio estatal, viven en casa propia, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Tunari  de la ciudad de El Alto.

El estudió hasta el nivel de Técnico Medio y actualmente desempeña las funciones de Oficial de Policía en la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo requiere para comprar material de construcción: cemento y fierro. Así podrá hacer el vaciado del piso de su vivienda, que aún es de tierra, para su familia y brindarles mayor comodidad.

El sueño de Hernan es tener una vivienda confortable para su familia.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Hernán’s married and has a school-age son attending public school; they live in their own house located in the city of El Alto’s Villa Tunari zone.  He completed mid-technical education level and works as a police officer for the city of El Alto.  He needs the loan to buy building materials like cement and iron to lay a floor in his house which is still dirt to provide his family with more comfort.  Hernán’s dream is to have a comfortable house for his family.  This is the first time he’s asked IMPRO and KIVA for a loan.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Yamil

texts.es:
Yamil, es casado y tiene un hijo que está en etapa escolar en un colegio estatal, viven en casa de sus padres, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Arasaya kentuyo en la localidad de Achacachi.

El estudio hasta el nivel de Técnico Medio y actualmente desempeña las funciones de Profesor de Música en una Escuela Privada Adventista en la localidad de Achacachi.

El crédito lo requiere para pagar un Curso de Especialización en el Área de Música. Así podrá mejorar sus ingresos para su familia y brindarles mayor comodidad.

El sueño de Yamil es ser un Profesor de música Especializado.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Yamil’s married and has a school-age son attending public school; they live in his parents’ house that’s located in the Arasaya Kentuyo zone in Achacachi.  He completed mid-technical level of education and works as a music teacher at a private Adventist school in Achacachi.  He needs the loan to pay for a music specialization course in order to improve his family income and provide more comfort for them.  Yamil’s dream is to become a specialized music teacher.  This is his first loan request to IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to pay for a music course.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza, de 46 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y alegre, así como amable y con muchas ganas de progresar, esta casada con Cesar quien  trabaja en el ministerio publico. Vive en compañía de su pareja, sus dos hijos de 24 y 18 años de edad. Habitando cómodamente en una casa alquilada. La actividad que realiza Maritza es la venta de comidas rápidas en las noches, como pollos broster y alitas fritas, entre otros, instalándose en el frontis de una bodega cerca de la casa de su madre, dedicándose a este negocio cerca de 1 años, contando con la ayuda de su hermana. Además también se dedica a la venta de ropas de damas y caballeros que le envía de su tía desde la ciudad de Lima cada 02 meses para luego venderlo de manera ambulatorio junto a su hijo mayor  entre sus amistades y clientes de su venta de comidas.
Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que le permite tener una ocupación ya que no pudo concluir sus estudios superiores y por la necesidad de tener un oficio y un ingreso económico con el cual apoyar a su pareja en los gastos de su hogar ya que sus hijos tenias gastos en lo estudios y tenían más necesidades, ahora viendo los buenos resultados por los ganancias que le genera, tiene planes de abrir una boutique o un restaurante. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de ropa de damas y caballeros a precio por mayor para venderlo entre sus amistades pensando en ésta campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Maritza, 46, is a hardworking, cheerful woman in addition to being kind with a strong wish to make progress.  She’s married to Cesar who works for the public defender’s office.  She lives comfortably in a rented house with her spouse and two children who are 24 and 18 years of age.

Maritza’s work is selling fast-food like Broasted chicken and fried chicken wings, among others at night.  She sets up in front of a store near her mother’s house.  She’s been in business for about a year and her sister helps her.  She also works selling women’s and men’s clothes that her aunt sends her from Lima every two months to then sell from place to place with her oldest so among her acquaintances and her fast-food customers.

What she enjoys about her work is that it allows her to have an occupation since she was unable to complete higher education and needed to have a job and income to help her husband with household expenses since her children had schooling costs and more needs.  Now, seeing the good results she gets from generated profits, she plans to open a boutique or a restaurant.  She will use the requested 1,000 new soles to buy women’s and men’s clothes at wholesale prices to resell to her acquaintances in light of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy women's and men's clothes.

loans.name: La Caroza Group

texts.es: Francisco, tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus 6 hijos en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. En toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura, el tiene aproximadamente 35 años de trabajar con sus propios cultivos. Cultiva café, maíz y frijoles. La producción que obtiene la vende en el mercado local. El quiere que sus terrenos y los cultivos tengan mejor asistencia técnica para sacar mejores cosechas y obtener más ganancias ya que tiene planes a futuro de comprar dos manzanas más de terreno ya cultivado de café. El ha solicitado un préstamo en forma grupal para comprar fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra, para darle un buen mantenimiento al cultivo de café, maíz y frijoles. El grupo se llama La Caroza y está formado por 12 miembros que en la foto se identifican de la siguiente manera: a la izquierda de pie esta el coordinador Francisco, seguido esta Luis, Yessica, Victoria, Jose, y el señor Santos, y agachado a la izquierda esta Constantino, Neptali, doña Santos, Zoila, Simeón y Jose Antonio a la derecha. Todos viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a la agricultura. El préstamo grupal total es por L. 73,000 y lo invertirán en el mantenimiento de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Francisco is 43 years old, and lives with his wife and their six children in a village which is part of the municipality of Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara. He has farmed his whole life, and has approximately 35 years of working with his own crops. He grows coffee, corn and beans, and sells his output in the local market. 

He wants his land and crops to have better technical assistance so that he can have better harvests and obtain better profits, as he has future plans to buy two more manzanas (Central American unit of land measurement) of land already cultivated with coffee.

He has applied for a group loan in order to buy fertilizers and pay for labor, so that he can provide good maintenance to his coffee, corn, and bean crops.

The group is called "La Caroza" and is made up of 12 members who in the photo are identified as follows: on the left, standing, is Francisco, the coordinator; next to him is Luis, Yessica, Victoria, José and Santos. On the left, crouching, is Constantino, Neptali, Santos, Zoila, Simeón and José Antonio on the right. They all live in the same community and work in agriculture.

The total group loan is for 73,000 lempiras, and they will invest it in maintaining their crops.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay for labor for growing coffee, corn and beans.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es: Rodolfo, de 42 años es un hombre honesto y trabajador. Vive en compañía de su esposa Ceferina y sus 6 hijos; a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace 12 años. Hace 12 años, Rodolfo implementó su granja de cuyes en un espacio exclusivo de su casa, ahí cuida de sus 500 ejemplares, los cuales atiende con mucho profesionalismo. Ya que los separa de acuerdo a rasgos genético, evitando que exista cruce familiar, de esa manera obtiene buenos ejemplares para la venta.”Tengo compradores fijos para mis cuyes, pues es un alimento rico en vitaminas, además se vende mucho el cuy negro en el mercado, por la creencia que sana algunos males”, comenta. Ahora espera poder aumentar más su producción, ya que tiene mucho campo para poder criar, además de tener muchos compradores y no se puede abastecer. Es por esa razón que espera tener éxito en su nuevo reto. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias, además el préstamo será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Rodolfo, invertirá el dinero en la compra de mallas, palos y demás accesorios para construir las jaulas de los cuyes y si el dinero le alcanza podrá también comprar cuyes de color negro.
texts.en:
Rodolfo is 42 years old, and is an honest, hard-working man. He lives with his wife, Ceferina, and their six children, who they raise in a house that Rodolfo bought twelve years ago. 

Twelve years ago, Rodolfo set up his guinea pig farm in an area of his home. He raises 500 guinea pigs there, which he looks after very professionally. He separates them according to their genetic traits, thereby avoiding inbreeding. As a result he gets good animals to sell. 

"I have regular customers for my guinea pigs, because they are a vitamin-rich foodstuff. Black guinea pigs also sell well in the market, because people believe that they cure certain ills." he says. 

He now hopes to increase production, as he has lots of land on which to farm as well as many customers, and he can't meet the demand. That is why he hopes to be successful in his new challenge. 

This is his third loan with MFP. He is very happy to know he has financial support, and he likes being part of his community bank because all the members are responsible and supportive. What's more, the loan will be very useful in the progression of his economic activity. Rodolfo will use the money to buy wire mesh, poles and other materials to build guinea pig cages, and if any money is left over, he will also be able to buy black guinea pigs.

loans.use: to buy wire mesh, poles and other materials to build guinea pig cages.

loans.name: Arzigul

texts.ru: Арзигул жительница района Дж. Руми. Ей 45 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Арзигул домохозяйка. Муж Арзигул занимается животноводством и земледелием. Ее дочь имеет средне - специальное образование. По специальности она портниха. Арзигул берет кредит для приобретения швейной машинки для свой дочери, чтобы она начала свою деятельность и стала самостоятельной. Так как дочь Арзигул не такой сильно уверенный в себе человек, Арзигул хочет помочь ей. Она надеется, что вы ей поможете в этом.
texts.en:
Arzigul is a resident of the J. Rumy region.  She is 45 years old, married and has three children. Arzigul is a homemaker. Arzigul's husband is engaged in raising animals and agriculture. Her daughter has a high school education. By speciality, she is a seamstress. 

Arzigul is taking a loan for the purchase of a sewing machine for her daughter, so she can start her own business and become independent. Since her daughter is not such a confident person, Arzigul wants to help her.  She hopes that you will help in this.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Khayriniso

texts.ru: Хайринисо проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Ей 66 лет. Она живет с мужем. Ее сын находится на заработках за рубежом. Хайринисо домохозяйка. Она берет кредит для приобретения швейной машинки, чтобы начать свою деятельность у себя дома. Хайринисо намерена заняться шитьем национальных платьев. Она очень трудолюбивая женщина.
texts.en:
Khayriniso lives in the region of J. Rumy. She is 66 years old and lives with her husband. Her son is working abroad. Khayriniso is a homemaker. 

She is taking a loan to buy a sewing machine to start her own activities from her home. Khayriniso intends to sew national dresses. She is a very hardworking woman.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Mastona

texts.ru: Мастона жительница города Дангара. Она 33 - летняя замужняя женщина. Мастона является матерью четверых детей. Она занимается растениеводством. Мастона берет кредит для переработки земли и выращивания овощей. Растениеводством Мастона занимается шесть лет.
texts.en:
Mastona is a resident of the town of Dangara.  She is a 33-year-old, married woman. Mastona is the mother of four children. 

She is engaged in raising crops. Mastona is taking a loan to prepare the land and grow vegetables. She has six years experience in growing crops.

loans.use: to prepare land and buy seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Abenawa

texts.en:
Abenawa  is married and has four children. In Elmina, she sells fruit and maize in small and large quantities which she has done for four years. Her husband is a tailor. Abenawa uses her income to help her partner to pay utility bills. 

Abenawa will use the loan to purchase a variety of fruit, like oranges, and bags of maize for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abenawa plans to save to buy land.

loans.use: to purchase variety of fruit, like oranges, and bags of maize for resale.

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en:
Tahir is 62 years old. He lives his wife and three children at the house that he owns.

The only source of income for the family is a taxi service, a business that he has been engaged in for 30 years. His son works in rotation with him in their car to help Tahir in supporting the family. They plan to renew the car. But the first reason for the loan is home repair. He has applied for 1000 AZN to buy construction materials and start the repairs that will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to make home repairs.

loans.name: Mahabat

texts.ru: Махабат 35 лет, замужем , воспитывает 5 детей, младшая дочка новорожденная. Махабат в качестве основного дохода с 1990 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 15,000 сом купив одну корову. Землю Махабат получила после развала СССР. Где ежегодно сажают фасоль и картофель. Благодаря упорному труду Махабат и её семьи  в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 1 дойная корова, 1 лошадь, 30 голов овец и 2 козы. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет 3,500 сом KGS от продажи молока и молочной продукции. Доход от полеводства  позволяет приобрести овец и быков в конце сезона. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Махабат обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота и оплату услуг на подготовку поля к весеннему посеву. Доходы от кредита Махабат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины в целях откорма и увеличение дохода от продажи молока , чтобы накопить средства на обучение детей.
texts.en:
Mahabat is 35 years old, married, and is raising five children, the youngest daughter of which is a newborn. 

As a main source of income since 1990, Mahabat has been engaged in raising livestock and agriculture, starting with 15,000 Som and the purchase of one cow. Mahabat received land before the breakup of the USSR where she does annual planting of beans and potatoes. Through hard work, Mahabat and her family currently have in their household one dairy cow, a horse, 30 sheep, and two goats. Monthly income from the business is 3,500 Som KGS from the sale of milk and dairy products. Income from growing crops allows her to buy sheep and cattle at the end of the season. 

With the goal of further developing her business, Mahabat appealed to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 Som (KGS) to buy livestock and to pay for preparation of her land for seeding.  Mahabat plans to use income from the loan to invest in further expanding the count of domestic livestock for fattening and an increase in income from the sale of milk, with the goal of saving money for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase cows and sheep and to pay for field preparation for seeding

loans.name: Kholmirzo

texts.ru: Холмирзо проживает в городе Дангара. Ему 46 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Холмирзо занимается частным извозом. Этим видом деятельности он занимается семь лет. Холмирзо берет кредит для ремонта своего легкового автомобиля, чтобы продолжить свою работу.
texts.en:
Kholmirzo lives in the town of Dangara. He is 46 years old, married, and has two children. Kholmirzo is engaged as a taxi driver. He has been doing this kind of work for seven years. 

Kholmirzo is taking a loan to repair his passenger vehicle, in order to continue his work.

loans.use: to repair his passenger vehicle

loans.name: Komba

texts.en:
Kumba is 49 years old and lives in Buchanan. She’s married and has eleven children between the ages of 8 and 22. They are attending school and living at home, and her husband is pastoring a church. For the past six years she has been into the business of selling rice, popcorn, bread, and candy. She enjoys the business because she makes a lot of profit.

Kumba is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, popcorn, bread and candy to resell. She hopes to build a house for her children and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, popcorn, bread and candy to resell.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia is a married woman and a mother of four grown children. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for several years. She is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets and pig feed.

Lucresia dreams of expanding her hog raising business in the future, in order to augment her income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba sells kenkey (fermented maize dough) at Dompoase, near Elmina. She is a single parent, who has seven children. Aba has been selling kenkey for the past five years. As a single parent, she is responsible for the general up-keep of her children, and so she uses her income for that. Whatever she has left, she saves for the future or reinvests in the business. She will use her loan to buy maize, for the production of kenkey to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy maize, for the production of kenkey to sell.

loans.name: Jeanne Nepomuscene

texts.en: Jeanne Nepomuscene is a mother of two children. She sells both locally-made beers and brewery-made. She wants the loan, to buy more beers for sale. With the profits from the business, she will make savings.

loans.use: to buy more beers for resale.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice is 40 years old, married, and has five children. He owns a carpentry workshop in Muhoroni, which he has been doing for eight years earning an income of 5,000 KES.  

Maurice is requesting his third loan from KADET LTD for 20,000 KES, which he will use to purchase timber for his workshop. He will use the profits to invest in his business and repay the loan.  He hopes to expand his workshop and be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase timber for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Obdulia

texts.es:
Obdulia, de 42 años, vive con su  esposo y 4 hijos en su propia casa, ubicada en la localidad del Tambo. Desde  hace 5 años tiene un negocio estable, la venta de golosinas en una escuela cerca de su casa, ahí ella obtiene durante el años el ingreso estable que requiere su casa. Pero el trabajo al que hace poco incursionó y al que desea incrementar el capital económico, es la venta de animales, en principal ovejas pequeñas de buena calidad. Las cuales comercializa en la feria ganadera que se desarrolla todos los fines de semana en la ciudad. Espera dentro de muy poco manejar mayor capital de dinero para comprar más ovejas y revenderlas a mayor precio, pues tiene ya muchos clientes a los cuales desea brindarles ovejas de mejor calidad. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias, además el préstamo será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica.
Obdulia, invertirá el dinero en la compra de 40 ovejas para realizar su negocio de compra y venta.
texts.en:
Obdulia, who is 42 years old, lives with her husband and 4 children in their own home which is located in the Tambo area. For the past 5 years she has run a business selling sweets at a nearby school. This business is stable and it provides the regular income that she needs for her household. 

However, a short while ago she started working in another activity: the sale of animals, principally good quality lambs. It is for this that she wants to increase her economic capital. She sells them at the livestock market held in the city every weekend. In the short-term she hopes to have higher capital in order to buy more sheep and sell them at a higher price. She already has many customers and she would like to be able to supply them with better quality sheep.

This is her fifth loan with MFP. She is very happy in the knowledge that she has financial support. Furthermore she enjoys being part of her communal bank as all of the members are responsible and supportive, Also the loan will be very useful in helping to progress this economic activity.

Obdulia will invest the money in the purchase of 40 sheep for her animal trade business.

loans.use: to buy 40 sheep

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 44 years old. She sells different items in her store. With the loan, she wants to buy more sugar, rice, and cooking oil for sale. The profits from the business will be used for making savings.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a father of three children and has been in the farming business for six successive years, in his rural home in Kitale, Western Kenya. He runs his farm with the help of one farmhand, currently, and he sells his produce of milk, eggs and tomatoes.

William has requested a loan of 36,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, to buy and insure a dairy cow. He aspires to run a farm of five, good-quality dairy cows.  In addition, he wants to establish a grain milling machine in the local market, for additional income.

William says the shortage of animal feeds remains the major challenge to him. He says the income from the new dairy cow will help boost his family business.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en: Immaculee is 60 years old and has two adult children. She sells bananas, which she has been doing for 10 years. Immaculee is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more bananas to sell. She will use the profits to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase bananas to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a mother of four young children from Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in a mobile phone electronic reloading business for sometime now. This is the source of her income.

Jocelyn is asking for a loan to buy more electronic load so that she will be able to have more customers. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to make her business a success.
