Pour ce faire, Anne-Marie Ablavi et les autres membres du groupe " MAHUGNON 9 " sollicitent pour une quatrième fois, l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
"Mahugnon 9" is a group of 3 people whose members are friends and live in the same region. The group's leader, Anne-Marie Ablavi, is the one with her hand raised in the picture. Anne-Marie Ablavi is 43 years old. She did not go to school. Anne-Marie Ablavi is married to Emmanuel. The couple have 4 dependent children, all of whom attend school. Anne-Marie Ablavi and Emmanuel live together with their children and take care of the different household responsibilities together.

Anne-Marie Ablavi sells condiments and vegetable oil from her home. She also sells corn as a sideline business. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. This business allows her to meet her needs and those of her children without too much difficulty. 

Anne-Marie Ablavi would like to increase her level of business. In order to do this, she and the other members of the "Mahugnon 9" group are requesting financial support from ALIDé for the fourth time, with a view to strengthening their businesses and better meeting the demands of their customers. The previous loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn and peanut oil.

loans.name: Toni

texts.en:
Toni is the owner of The Elite and Performing Arts Center in Woodland Hills. She offers dance classes, birthday parties, and she sells dancewear for adults and children.  The staff offers ballet, tap, jazz, hip-hop, ballroom, acrobatics, and even Zumba classes for children and adults. 

Most of the marketing is done through word of mouth and social media but Toni does send out mailers, post cards, and brochures to different schools in the community. She has hired one staff member as Marketing Manager to help her contact different schools, attend all school events, and market the company's dance classes. 

The Elite Dance and Performing Arts Center Inc. is seeking a $10,000 loan to pay three months of rent while they renovate an extra room in the studio to add more dance classes.

loans.use: To pay three months of rent while they renovate an extra room in the studio to add more dance classes

loans.use: to buy more spices and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is a 63-year-old married woman with eight grown children from Duero, Bohol. She has been engaged in farming and gardening for 20 years now together with her husband. She earns 2,000 PHP monthly. This is the source of her income.

Arsenia is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, seedlings and nylon. Through this loan, she can continue planting crops and have a good production. In the future, Arsenia dreams of expanding her business and being productive.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings and nylon.

loans.name: Twegondezehamu Group

texts.en:
Yusuf is a married man aged 33 with two children and taking care of two dependents. He is a mechanic and also sells spare parts. He started his business in 2003, and his intention was to have a source of income to be able to look after the family.

Yusuf wants the loan to buy bicycle spare parts so that he can meet the demand of his clients. Many people there use bicycles as their major means of transport. He will get income to meet the family needs. He has a challenge with the transport and sometimes the delay in supply because of frequent orders due to limited capital. 

Yusuf's future prospects when he gets this loan are to increase his income and help those who drop out of the school with the mechanical skills since he is a skilled person in mechanics.

loans.use: To buy bicycle spare parts.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance

loans.name: 3.14.208.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Hà, 36, operates a food stall/restaurant. She is married with two children.  Her business is located in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.  Hà has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell.

Hà is the group leader of the 3.14.208.Thiệu Khánh solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

This is Hà's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns Hà is the lack of capital.

With her profits, Hà hopes to keep her family healthy and happy.  She also want her children to do well in school.  Hà also hopes to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods,snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a 49 year old married woman with six minor children, from Jagna, Bohol.  She has operated a sari sari (variety store) business for 10 years.  This is the source of her income.  Her husband is a driver.

Emma is requesting for a loan to buy items like toiletries, canned goods, noodles, food snack and more. 

Through this loan, she will be able to put many more items in her store and attract the interest of customers in her local community.

Emma hopes to expand her business and become more profitable in the future. She wants to send all her children to school and for them to have a better education.

loans.use: to buy items like toiletries, can goods, noodles. food snacks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy scrap for scrap selling business.

loans.name: 3.11.214.thiệu Ngọc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Liên operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell. 

Liên has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. Liên is 33 years old and she is married with two children. Liên supports two dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Liên is the group leader of the 3.11.214.Thiệu Ngọc solidarity group, which consists of six members. In 2011, Liên  joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Liên  has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Liên hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell.

loans.name: 3.14.209.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lâm has a service business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing to resell. 

Lâm is 35 years old and she is married with two  children. Lâm supports two dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Lâm has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Lâm is the group leader of the 3.14.209.Thiệu Khánh  solidarity group, which consists of five members. In 2012, Lâm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Lâm has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

With her business profit, Lâm hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To service the vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy embroidery materials for an embroidery business.

loans.name: 3.10. 211. Thiệu Chính Group

texts.en:
Hiền, 39, is is the leader of the 3.10. 211 Thiệu Chính solidarity group, which consists of three members.  The group is situated in the Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.  Hiền is married with three children. 

She has been a poultry and cattle farmer for more than 10 years.  Hiền is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future.  This is Hiền first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

One of the group's most critical business difficulties concerns a lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hiền hopes to maintain a successful business, and be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in future.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 34 years old and married with three children. She is from Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. Josephine does hog-raising to make a living. She has been in her business for three years and earns 10,000 PHP a month. 

Josephine joined GDMPC in 2011. Josephine is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 59 years old, married. and has four children. She is from Inasagan, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. 

Lolita owns and operates a hog-raising business to earn a living. Lolita has been in business for four years and she earns 4,000 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Lolita joined GDMPC. Lolita is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase feeding supplies. Lolita wants to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Guadioso

texts.en:
Guadioso, 50 years old, is a married entrepreneur of Anonang, Aurora, with two children.

He has had a transport service business for almost three years now and he earns 6,000 PHP a month. 

To improve business, he wants to borrow 15,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit, which he joined in 2011, to obtain accessories and tires. Before long, he’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en: Gayane lives in Sayat Nova village with her parents. She studies international relations at Yerevan State University. Her parents are simple working people and their income doesn't allow them to pay for Gayane's education. So Gayane has applied for the loan to pay for her tuition. The loan will help her to complete her education and become a good specialist. Gayane dreams to find a well-paying job and help her parents to sustain the family.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a resident of Kilifi, Coast province, Kenya. She is a single mother of three school going children. Janet runs a food cafe, a business that she has been running for four years. She also runs a poultry/livestock farm and a green grocery stall.
She learnt about Milango from an employee and joined the institution with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is lack of funds to grow the business and fluctuating prices.
Janet is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to purchase food items for the café and to rebuild a poultry shelter. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve on the living standard of her family, especially the education of her children. She aspires to own a café in future.

loans.use: To purchase food items for the café and rebuild a poultry shelter.

loans.name: Kipkoech

texts.en:
Kipkoech is a forty-four year old farmer in Litein County, Kenya where he lives with his wife and five children who are all in school.  He has been farming for the past twelve years producing beans, potatoes, maize and milk which he sells at the local market in his area.
He is requesting a loan for 60,000 KES to construct a dairy unit for his dairy cows, which will assist him in taking better care of his animals and thus getting more production.  This will earn him extra income to help him pay for his children's schooling and uplift his living standards.  He aspires to buy two more cows in the next five years.
Kipkoech is very grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for the funds and is willing to work even harder to be able to get more in the future that will help him grow his farm.

loans.use: To purchase materials for constructing a dairy unit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shavers and other business equipment.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en: Emelia is from Anonang, Aurora. She is 56 years old. Emelia is married and has 4 children. To make a living, she manages a business buying and selling fish and crabs. She has been in her business for 3 years and earns 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2011, Emelia joined GDMPC. Emelia is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to buy additional fish and crabs to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish and crabs to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en:
Bonface is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. He is a single business man. Bonface is a milk supplier. He was introduced to Milango by his friends. He also works as a driver in the public transport sector.
He is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to purchase milk for sale. He looks forward to owning a premise from where he can sell milk despite the challenge of some clients not paying on time. 
Bonface will use the extra income from this loan to pay for school fees. He dreams of owning a milk depot in future.

loans.use: to purchase milk for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods,snacks and beverages

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is married and has two children. James is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines.  He operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for four years, and every month he earns 9,000PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 25,000PHP to repair  his existing vehicle for better service.

James been a member of GDMPC since 2007.  In the future, James hopes to fund the studies of his children and to gain double income from his business.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
El Señor Alejandro tiene 63  años de edad,  vive con su esposa en su casa de habitación un una aldea de Choluteca al sur de Honduras, el trabaja en serna  desde hace 15 años como motorista, y su esposa  se dedica a elaborar quesos para la venta, ellos tienen ganado con el cual producen los quesos. 
Don Alejandro está solicitando 20,000.00 lempiras para compra de laminas, clavos, cemento, vigas y tablas que son los materiales para arreglar el techo se su casa, y hacer una poza séptica ya que esta deteriorando 
Don Alejandro su  sueño es comprarse un carro para transportarse con su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre  del 2012.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 63 years old and lives with his wife in a home in the Choluteca area in southern Honduras.  He works as a driver and has done so for 15 years.  His wife makes cheeses to sell and they also have some livestock.

Alejandro is asking for 20,000 Lempiras to buy metal, nails, cement, beams, and lumber to fix the roof in his home and build a septic tank because the current one is deteriorating.

His dream is to buy a car so that he can transport his family.

loans.use: to fix his roof and build a septic tank.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods,snacks and beverages

loans.name: Malkhazi

texts.en: Malkhazi is 37 years old and lives in Zestaponi district, with his wife and two children (three and nine years old). The elder son is a schoolboy and the younger daughter goes to the local kindergarten. The only source for the family is the small income earned by Malkhaz. He is involved in a trading business. In particular, he buys fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices, transports them by his own car and sells at the local open market.   Malkhazi managed to make some savings and built a store, where he plans to set up a grocery. He has requested a loan several times, but his loan requests were rejected each time because he did not meet income requirements and he lacks experience in new business, which is usually demanded by local credit providers. But Malkhazi’s loan request was approved by Credo, as part of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides credit for business start-ups and re-startups. The program extends soft conditions to the rural poor who do not have access to credit products. They are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, Malkhazi will cover the costs of purchasing his initial inventory of basic groceries for starting a grocery store. He plans to increase the turnover in his trade business gradually. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of the family.  Malkhazi will work hard, and he will be able to improve the living conditions for his family. With this loan, his family will generate enough income to access regular, available credit products in the country’s capital market, in the event they need it in the future.

loans.use: to start up a grocery store

loans.name: Baraka

texts.en:
Baraka is 25 years old, married and a father of two children. For the last three years, he has earned a living by selling fresh fish in Malindi. He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers and earns a monthly income of about KES.10,000. 

He has currently borrowed his first loan of KES.15,000 to buy additional stock of fish for his business so as to sell to his customers. He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for his children's school fees. 

Baraka's goal for the future is to own a fish depot in the area, something that would help improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of  fish

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bedsheets to sell for profit.

loans.name: Fazirale

texts.en:
Fazirale is 18 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fortportal region of Uganda. For the past three years, Fazirale has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells raw food. 

To help expand her business, Fazirale has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more raw food such as cassava, sweet potatoes to resell, and will help Fazirale to generate greater profits and pay for her medical bills. Fazirale hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Fazirale is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more raw food such as cassava and sweet potatoes to resell.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James lives in Mombasa area of Coast province, Kenya. He is a married father of four children and owns a green grocery stall which he has been operating for 10 years. In this business, James sells greens, fruits, vegetables, cereals etc. He is also employed.

James learned about Milango through a friend and joined with the aim to access credit to improve his business. The challenges he is facing are bad debts and high cost of transport.

He is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy greens, fruits, vegetables, cereals, etc in wholesale. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to expand the business. His plans for the future are to start other businesses and also open stalls in other areas.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, fruits and cereals for wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make snacks.

loans.name: Shushanik

texts.en:
Shushanik lives in Vostan village of Ararat region with her husband and two sons. Together with her husband, Shushanik is involved in agriculture. They keep 30 chickens and also have a plot of land where pear, nut, apple and apricot trees are grown. As agriculture is the only source of income for this family, they would like to expand it. 

Shushanik has requested this loan to purchase tomato seeds and fertilizer to cultivate tomatoes for selling it during the next season. Because their greenhouse is very old and needs to be improved, Shushanik will use the other part of the loan in purchasing polyethylene cover for the greenhouse to renovate it. This will help her to cultivate more vegetables in the future, which will significantly increase the family income.

loans.use: to pay for tomato seeds, fertilizer, and polyethylene cover for the greenhouse in order to renovate the greenhouse.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Yaser

texts.en:
Yaser is from Iraq. He is a youth client, aged 24. He is single and living with two family members, of whom one is employed.

Yaser owns a computer shop. He specializes in printing books and computer maintenance. He established his business in 2009, and now he has an employee. He acquired good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area and has an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a $3,000 youth loan to buy two new laptops and a modern printing machine as well as to increase his inventory. He is aiming to expand his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 2 new laptops and a modern printing machine as well as to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.ru:
Шаходат молодая женщина,ей 40 лет и у неё двое детей. Она растет своих детей одна, без мужа. Её муж умер давно и ей очень трудно воспитывать детей в одиночку, ведь дети растут и их расходы тоже растут. Но несмотря на трудности Шаходат не отчаивается и старается работать. 
  Шаходат работает в государственном учреждении. Получает зарплату и еще дополнительно, сдает в аренду торговую точку на центральном рынке. У Шаходат растет дочь и скоро она планирует выдавать дочь замуж, но ее квартира в очень плохом состоянии и нуждается в ремонте. До свадьбы дочери Шаходат хочет сделать косметический ремонт в своей квартире. Для этого ей не хватает денежных средств поэтому она обратилась в Арванд за финансовой поддержкой.
 На полученный кредит Шаходат хочет купить строительные материалы для ремонта своей квартиры.  Она очень благодарна организации Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Shahodat is a young woman. She is 40 years old and has two children. She is raising her children on her own, without her husband. Her husband died a long time ago and it is very hard to bring up the children alone. As the children grow, so too their expenses grow. But despite the difficulties, Shahodat does not despair and is trying to work. 

Shahodat works in a public office. She receives a salary and in addition leases a kiosk in the central market. Shahodat's daughter is growing up and soon she plans to give her daughter in marriage, but her apartment is in very poor condition and is in need of repair. Before her daughter's wedding, Shahodat wants to make cosmetic repairs in the apartment. She does not have enough money to do this, so she appealed to Arvand for financial support.

With the loan received, Shahodat wants to buy building materials to repair her apartment. She is very grateful to Arvand for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.es:
Antonieta de 46 años, convive con Gabino con quien tiene 3 hijos de 27, 25 y 7 años, pero solo vive con el menor de ellos. Su casa es propia y se ubica en un distrito de la selva central.

Antonieta es una mujer apacible y carismática. Cuenta con un negocio instalado en su propia casa, ahí expende productos de primera necesidad a los vecinos de su zona. Hace 3 años que trabaja así, “se vende más las gaseosas y cervezas los fines de semanas, pero los días particulares los abarrotes, verduras y la carne de pollo”, comenta.
En todo éste tiempo laborando consiguió buenos y malos clientes, pero aprendió a lidiar con ese tipo de líos.
Su principal problema era la falta de capital, pero con la ayuda de su banco comunal logró superar esos inconvenientes.
Ahora sus metas está enfocadas en mejorar sus ventas, para ello piensa adquirir productos como panteones y algunos juguetes, por esta temporada navideña. Éste sería su préstamo número 12 con MFP, gracias a su ayuda, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Heliconias”, menciona sentirse a gusto con sus socias.
Invertirá los 1500 soles en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda, como sacos de arroz, azúcar, aceite, carne de pollo.
texts.en:
Antonieta, 46, lives with Gabino, with whom she has three children, ages 27, 25, and 7, but only the youngest lives with them.  Her house is her own; it's located in an area of the central jungle.

Antonieta's a calm and charismatic woman.  She has a business set up in her house where she sells staple items to her neighbors.  She's been doing this work for three years.  "On the weekend I sell more soda and beer, but during the week it's groceries, vegetables, and chicken," she says.

In all this time working she has had good and bad customers, but she learned to contend with this type of problem.  Her main problem was the lack of capital, but she managed to overcome that with the help of her communal bank.

Now her goals are focused on improving her sales, so she plans to acquire products for the Christmas season such as panettone and some toys.  This would be her twelfth loan with MFP.  She's grateful for their help so she's committed to being punctual in making her payments.  She belongs to Las Heliconias Communal Bank and says she feels comfortable with the members.

She'll invest the 1500 soles [PEN] in buying staple products to stock her store: bags of rice, sugar, oil, and chicken.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, and chicken

loans.name: Los Emprendedores Group

texts.es: Don Mario tiene 45 años de edad, es miembro del Grupo Solidario Los Emprendedores, es casado y tiene 3 hijos, su esposa se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y sandalias, ellos residen en la Colonia La Morita de la ciudad Juticalpa. Don Mario inicio su negocio desde hace 8 años con la ayuda de un tío luego decidió independizarse y actualmente se dedica a la venta de medicinas naturales y farmacéuticas, sale desde el lunes y regresa el sábado a las aldeas y comunidades a vender su producto. La ventaja es que tiene sus propios clientes y la desventaja es que por vender de forma ambulante corre el riesgo de que lo asalten. El préstamo que don Mario solicita lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de medicinas naturales, farmacéuticas y para matar insectos. Con el apoyo de este préstamo don Mario podrá continuar con su negocio y mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Una de sus metas es terminar su casa y tener su propio local. Don Mario tiene más de seis años de ser cliente de FAMA y ha cancelado sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Mario, 45, is a member of Los Emprendedores Solidarity Group.  He's married and has three children.  His wife makes a living selling new clothes and sandals.  They live in the La Morita area of the city of Juticalpa.

Mario started his business eight years ago with the help of an uncle who later decided to work on his own.  Currently he makes a living selling natural and pharmaceutical medicine.  He leaves on Monday for the towns and communities to sell his products and returns on Saturday.  The advantage is that he has his own customers; the disadvantage is that he runs the risk of being assaulted because he sells on foot.

Mario needs this loan to invest in buying medicines: natural, pharmaceutical, and to kill insects.  With the support of this loan Mario will be able to continue with his business and improve his living conditions.  One of his goals is to finish his house and have his own store.

Mario has been a client of FAMA for more than six years and he has made his payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy natural medicine and pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Kanoko

texts.en:
Kanoko is 35 years old, married, and blessed with four children whom he supports. He operates a video show shop and sells movies. He has been in this business for the last 12 years, earning an income of KES 30,000 monthly. 

He requesting his fourth loan, in the amount of KES 40,000, from KADET LTD. The loan will facilitate his business expansion by enabling him to buy more CDs and employ additional staff.

Kanoko intends to use the anticipated profits to support his business and provide for his family's basic needs. His dream is to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more CDs and employ additional staff.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is from Iraq. He is 51 years old, married, and has five children. Mohammed is the only provider for the family.

Mohammed is a technician. He specializes in repairing televisions and other electronics. He established his business in 1994. He has amassed good experience in this field, and he is well-known in the surrounding area, with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan to buy a small generator and install a sliding door and a new rolling shutter for his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a small generator and install a sliding door and a new rolling shutter for his shop

loans.name: Godofredo

texts.en:
Godofredo is a 32-year-old married man with two children: one boy and one girl. He is from Jagna, Bohol, where he has operated a motorcycle transportation business for 5 years. This business is the source of his income and provides the family's daily needs.

Godofredo is requesting a loan to buy tires, motor oil, gasoline, and spare parts for his motorcycle. With this loan, he can ensure that his motorcycle is in good condition while he is driving. In the future, Godofredo hopes to expand his business and to have a new motor.

loans.use: to buy tires, motor oil, and gasoline

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 48-year-old married woman with one 23-year-old daughter from Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. She has been engaged in a business buying and selling for two years with the help of her daughter. This is the source of her income. She earns 5,000 PHP monthly. Her husband is a farmer. 

Elizabeth is requesting a loan to buy t-shirts, shoes and pants. By the use of this loan, she will be able to buy these things and then sell them to her local community to gain profit.

In the future, Elizabeth dreams of expanding her business and reconstructing their home.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, shoes and pants.

loans.name: Amour 1 Group

texts.fr: " AMOUR 1 " est un groupe de trois personnes, qui résident dans la même région. La représentante du groupe, Florentine est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Florentine est âgée de 38 ans et est mariée à Sylvain. Florentine a très peu fréquenté l'école. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Florentine et Sylvain vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Florentine est une coiffeuse. De façon secondaire, Florentine vend des mèches et des produits pour cheveux. Florentine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir sans grande difficulté à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Florentine et les autres membres du groupe "AMOUR 1" sollicitent pour une première fois, l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
"Amour 1" is a group of 3 people whose members live in the same area. The group's leader, Florentine, is the one with her hand raised in the picture. Florentine is 38 years old and is married to Sylvain. She did not get much schooling. The couple have 3 dependent children, some of whom attend school. Florentine and Sylvain live together with their children and take care of the different household responsibilities together.

Florentine is a hairdresser. She also sells hair extensions and hair products as a sideline business. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. This business allows her to meet her needs and those of her children without too much difficulty.

Florentine and the other members of the "Amour 1" group are requesting financial support from ALIDé for the first time, with a view to increasing their working capital and their business levels, and better meeting the demands of their customers.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and hair products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour.

loans.name: Mignonmide Group

texts.fr: "MIGNONMIDE" est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même village et font des tontines ensemble. La représentante du groupe, Joséphine est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo et est âgée de 52 ans. Joséphine est mariée à Benoît. Joséphine n’a pas fréquenté. Le couple à trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Joséphine vend du vin de palme, du maïs et de l’huile rouge à son domicile. Joséphine s’approvisionne dans les régions du Bénin. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir sans grande difficulté, à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Joséphine et les autres membres du groupe " MIGNONMIDE " sollicitent pour une troisième fois, l’appui financier de ALIDé afin d’acheter des noix de palme et du vin de palme en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
"Mignonmide" is a group of 3 people whose members live in the same village and are members of the same tontines. The group's leader, Joséphine, is the one with her hand raised in the picture and is 52 years old. Joséphine is married to Benoît. She did not go to school. The couple have 3 children, some of whom go to school. The couple live together with their children and take care of the different household responsibilities together.

Joséphine sells palm wine, corn and red palm oil from her home. She gets her supplies in the districts of Benin. This business allows her to meet her needs and those of her children without too much difficulty.

Joséphine and the other members of the "Mignonmide" group are requesting financial support from ALIDé for the 3rd time so that they can increase their working capital and buy palm nuts and palm wine, with a view to strengthening their businesses and better meeting the demands of their customers. The previous loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy palm wine and palm nuts.

loans.name: Anarkan

texts.ru: Анаркан 52 года, вдова, воспитала 6 детей. Анаркан после распада Советского Союза начала заниматься животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Анаркан, ее хозяйство на сегодняшний день  у нее очень развитое хозяйство, доходы от которого достаточны для покрытия основных нужд семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Анаркан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов мелкого скота. Доходы от кредита Анаркан планирует вложить в ремонт дома,в дальнейшее развитие своего хозяйства и вкладывать в образование детей и их будущее.
texts.en:
Anarkan is a 52-year-old widow, who brought up six children. After the breakup of the Soviet Union, Anarkan started to raising livestock, starting this business with 20,000 Som (KGS). Through Anarkan's hard work, her household today has a highly developed farm, the proceeds from which are enough to cover the basic needs of the family.

In order to further develop her business, Anarkan appealed to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 Som (KGS) to buy additional livestock. Anarkan plans to invest income from the loan in home repairs, to further develop her household, and to save for her children's education and their future.

loans.use: To purchase 20 sheep

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en: Eugenia is a 60-year-old resident of Lantungan, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She provides for her children's needs from the little amount of PHP 3,000 she makes monthly from her pig business. She has had this business for three years and the money she makes supplements the income her husband earns. This year she became a member of GDMPC, and she applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feeding supplies. Eugenia wants to expand her business someday.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies for pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more medicines to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.en:
Marcos is a widower with two children. He is 59 years old and resides in Sumalig, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. Marcos cultivates coconuts for sale for their living and he has been in this business for five years. Each month he earns 20,000 PHP doing this type of business.

He has requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Marcos has been a member of Kiva Field Partner, GDMPC for one year. In the future, Marcos wants to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Maxim

texts.en:
Maxim is 41 years old. He was an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fizuli town, but now he lives in Fizuli region, in a Bala Bahmanli village with his family. He is married and has three children.

He loves his children and wife and he wants to increase his monthly income to improve the living conditions of his family. For that, Maxim needs 1,600 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) to repair his car, because, at present, his car isn't working, so he can't do his work.

loans.use: to repair his car.

loans.name: Felistus

texts.en:
Felistus is 35 years old now. She is single and has two children who are 16 and 11 years old. She has been in the charcoal business for seven years and has a monthly income of KES 15,000.

This loan will be used to buy more charcoal for resale. The anticipated profits will be used to pay for her children's school fees and food.

This is Felistus' third loan with Kiva Field Partner, KADET; she has successfully repaid her previous loan. Her hope and dream is to be financially stable and to provide quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is from Iraq. He is 48 years old, married, and has three children. Adnan, his wife, and two of his children provide the income for the family.

Adnan owns a small shop. He sells all the required materials for dyeing cars. He established his business in 2004 and now he has one employee. He has built good experience in this field, and he is well-known in the surrounding area, with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan to install a sliding door and a new rolling shutter for his shop. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he can provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to install a sliding door and a new rolling shutter for his shop

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en:
Otgonbayar is 28 years old and the mother of two sons, aged 2 and 8. She lives with her family in the outer ger (tent) district, which lacks the basic infrastructure of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Otgonbayar supports her family by operating a clothing business. She knits and sews blouses and jackets using camel wool. 

Previously, she was rented a small stall at the largest outdoor market in the city. Since the beginning of this year, she knits her products at home and sends them to the suburbs to be sold. She will use the requested loan to buy a variety of yarns.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of yarns.

loans.name: Kekel

texts.en:
Kekel lives in Meghri town with her husband and 23-year-old son. She is involved in agriculture. She breeds cattle and also has an agricultural land where peach, apricot, apple, pomegranate and fig trees are grown. She works hard in order to gather a good harvest and sell it in the local markets. Kekel's husband works out of the country as a constructor and provides financial assistance to his family. But because of the seasonality of his work he isn't able to cover the family's basic needs for the whole year. 

So, Kekel has requested the loan to expand her agricultural business. With the help of the loan she will purchase a calf and forage for feeding the livestock. She will raise and fatten that calf and will use its milk in the cheese production. Selling that cheese will increase her income and enable her to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to pay for a calf and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 34 years old, married and a mother of three children. She operates a small retail shop in Malindi for a living where she earns a monthly income of about KES 12,000. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

She has applied for a loan of KES 20,000 with which she intends to buy more stock of food stuff for sale in her retail shop. 

The client intends to continue growing her business and hopes that one day she will come to own a well established retail shop in the area.

loans.use: to buy more stock of food stuff for sale in her retail shop.

loans.name: Kritel Marvie

texts.en:
Kritel Marvie is a 24-year-old single mother with two sons ages three and two from Garcia-Hernandez, Bohol. She has been engaged in a food vending for 4 years now. This is the source of her income. She earns 2,500 PHP monthly. This is where she gets money for the whole needs of the family.

Kritel Marvie is requesting for a loan to buy bananas, sweet potatoes and sugar. With this loan, she will be able to buy fruit and make it into banana cue, camote cue or sweet potato cue. This food is suitable for merienda, or snacks.

In the future, Kritel Marvie dreams of expanding her business and earning savings so that she can educate her children.

loans.use: to buy bananas, sweet potatoes, and sugar.

loans.name: Arshad

texts.en:
Arshad is a very hard-working and active borrower with Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. He is 50 years old and lives in Rawalpindi with his family: a decent and responsible housewife, 4 sons, and 4 daughters. Two of his sons live abroad while rest of the children are students. 

Since 2002, Arshad has been running a small garment shop in the market. This shop is the only source of income for his family. The winter season has started in Pakistan, so he wants to purchase a variety of warm clothing, such as sweaters, coats, gloves, mufflers, and school jerseys. To do this, he has requested a loan in the amount of PKR 100,000. 

The loan will help him to offer a variety of products to his clients and increase his net income as well. Arshad dreams of increasing his business so that his children can have a better future. Arshad's family sends loads of prayers and thanks to all of the staff of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of warm clothing for his garment shop.

loans.name: Zuura

texts.ru: Зуура 61 год, замужем. Все дети Зуура уже взрослые и самостоятельные.  В поисках источника финансирования, 30 лет назад Зуура начала свой бизнес в животноводстве, стартовав с покупки одной дойной коровы и 5 овец. Благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Зуура имеется две дойной коровы одна лошадь и 25 овец, приносящее около 7,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. В целях увеличения поголовья скота, Зуура обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят и овец. Доходы от кредита семья планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение поголовья скота и улучшения благосостояния семьи
texts.en:
Zuura is 61 years old and married. All of Zuura's children are grown and living on their own. In search of a source of funding, Zuura started her own business 30 years ago in livestock, starting with the purchase of a dairy cow and five sheep. Through hard work and perseverance, Zuura today has in her farm two dairy cows, one hourse, and 25 sheep, bringing about 7,000 Som (KGS) per month from the sale of milk and meat products. 

In order to increase the number of her livestock, Zuura appealed to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 Som (KGS) to buy calves and sheep. The family plans to invest income from the loan to further multiplying the number of livestock and improving the welfare of the family.

loans.use: To purchase more sheep and calves

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухаббат 39 лет, замужем, мать 6 детей. Мухаббат имеет среднее образование, после окончания школы сразу вышла замуж. По характеру очень хороший человек. Имеет хорошие отзывы от соседей, они отзываются о ней как о порядочной и очень доброй женщиной. Мухаббат в качестве источника дохода для своей семьи,  начала заниматься полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Мухаббат в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется развитое хозяйство. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Мухаббат обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров и овец. Доходы от кредита Мухаббат планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса посредством покупки дополнительных голов скота. Забота о детях и обеспечение хорошего образования для них, это главная задача для Мухаббат и её мужа.
texts.en:
Muhabbat is 39 years old, married and the mother of six children. Muhabbat has a high school education and after graduating school immediately got married. By nature, she is a very good person. She gets good reviews from her neighbors; they speak of her as a very decent and kind woman. 

As a source of income for the family, Muhabbat started raising field crops and livestock. Through hard work, Muhabbat today has in her homestead a developed farm.

In order to further develop her business, Muhabbat appealed to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 Som (KGS) to buy cattle and sheep. Muhabbat plans to invest income from the loan in the development of the business through the purchase of additional livestock. 

Caring for the children and ensuring them a good education, these are the main concerns for Muhabbat and her husband.

loans.use: To purchase more cows and sheep

loans.name: Marziya

texts.ru: Марзие 41 год. Замужем, мать 3 детей. Старший сын взрослый, он работает в России, младшие учатся в школе.После развала СССР и развала коллективных хозяйств Марзия получила свой участок. И с тех пор она занимается животноводством и полеводством.Она начала свой бизнес с приобретения одной коровы. Благодаря стараниям и труду Марзии на сегодняшний день они имеют развитое хозяйство, в хозяйстве у них имеется 2 коровы и 10 голов овец. Ежемесяцный доход семьи от продажи молока и перепродажи скота оставляет 10,000 KGS. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Марзия обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на приобретение дополнительных голов скота, точнее она планирует приобрести 1 корову и овец, что позволит увеличить доходы семьи. Доходы от данного проекта она намерена вкладывать в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйство и вкладывать улучшение благосостояния семьи.
texts.en:
Marziya is 41 yeras old, married, and the mother of three children. Her eldest son is an adult and works in Russia, and the younger is attending school. After the collapse of the USSR and the collective farms, Marziya received her own plot of land. And since she was engaged in cattle breading and cultivating field crops, she started her own business with the acquisition of one cow. 

Through her efforts and hard work, Marziya today has a developed farm with two cows and ten head of sheep. The family's monthly income from the sale of milke and livestock comes to 10,000 KGS. 

In order to further develop her business, Marziya appealed to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 Som (KGS) to purchase additional livestock, or more specifically to buy one cow and sheep which will increase the family income. She intends to invest income from this project to further increase her farm and to save for the welfare of the family.

loans.use: To purchase a cow and sheep

loans.name: Yaakoub

texts.en:
Yaakoub is from Iraq. He is a youth client who is 21 and single. Yaakoub lives with seven family members, of whom four are employed.

Yaakoub owns a small shop for selling electronics. He established his business in 2011. He has acquired good experience in this field and he is well-known in the surrounding area and has an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a youth loan of $3,000 to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to expand his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Sami

texts.en:
Sami is from Iraq. He is 35 years old and married with six children. He is the only provider of the family.

Sami owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2005. He has good experience in this field, he is well-known in the surrounding area and he has an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a loan of $1,000 to increase his inventory. Sami is aiming to expand his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to increase his store's inventory.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is 20 years old and operates a cosmetics shop in Malindi town. She has been in the business for the last year. She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a credit officer and earns a monthly profit of about KES 10,000 

Everlyne is applying for her first loan of KES 20,000. She intends to use the loan to add some more perfumes, ornaments, hair weaves and so many other items for sale during this festive season. 

She will save the anticipated profit and help pay school fees for her niece. In the future, the client hopes to grow her cosmetic shop and hopes to eventually own her own well established boutique.

loans.use: to add some more perfumes, ornaments and hair weaves to her stock for sale.

loans.name: Delgertsetseg

texts.en:
Delgertsetseg is a 32-year-old married woman who has three cute girls and lives with her family in the outer Ger district. This area lacks basic infrastructure and is in the outskirts of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. She specialized in accountancy but works as a manager at private company. 

She has a small grocery store and she plans to rent it to others, but unfortunately her store is very old and unsafe. Thus she is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to purchase the necessary renovation construction materials.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 27-year-old single man. He has been working as an electrician since 10 years to help his family improve their living. Rami finished only his intermediate studies and had to start working early to support family income.

Education is very important to him; that's why he is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to pay for his brother's university fees and to make sure that his brother will accomplish what he could not accomplish himself. 

This is his first cycle as Al Majmoua borrower, and he hopes that it will have a positive impact on both his brother's studies and his business by buying necessary tools such as an upgraded compressor and new tools to facilitate his work.

He hopes to improve his business with the new tools.

loans.use: to pay for his brother's university costs, and buy necessary tools for his business.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa 2 Group

texts.es:
Kuña guapa 2 es un grupo integrado por 14 mujeres, quien han trabajo juntas por 19 ciclos, y ahora con mucho entusiasmo están en su ciclo numero 20. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y lo han demostrado en todo sentido.
Una de estas mujeres es la Sra. Maria Esther, quien además de ser miembro es la presidenta de este grupo. Ella las guía y las ayuda en todo lo que pueda para poder seguir creciendo juntas. Maria se dedica a la costura y por medio de las capacitaciones y de los créditos ha podido ir creciendo y ganándose el sustento de su familia. Quiere poder seguir trabajando y ayudando, no solo a los suyos sino también a los demás.
Pide este crédito para la compra de telas, hilo, y demás, para poder seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa 2 is a group made up of 14 women who have worked together for 19 cycles and with a lot of enthusiasm are in their 20th cycle. They are hardworking women and they demonstrate it in all ways.

One of these women is Maria Esther, who besides being a member is the president of this group. She guides them and helps them as much as possible so they can grow together. Maria works as a seamstress and through the training and loans has been able to grow and provide for her family with household earnings. She wants to continue working and helping, not only for herself but for the others too.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy fabric, thread, and more, in order to continue working and supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy thread fabric and thread for her work as a seamstress

loans.name: Las Tejedoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo llamado las tejedoras es de la ciudad de Caacupé, pese a ser un grupo bastante numeroso, se llevan muy bien y se ayudan las unas a las otras, ya que saben que por medio de la ayuda podrán hacer mejor las cosas y así también ayudar a sus familias por medio de ese trabajo.
La presidenta, la señora Norma vive con su marido e hijos, ella se dedica a la artesanía en ñanduti (tejido que se hace a mano) y también vende ropas.  Comenta Norma que quiere inculcarles a sus hijos es gran arte de ñanduti, ya que es un hermoso tejido, herencia de nuestra cultura.
Norma pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de hilos, y agujas de diferentes clases, para poder seguir haciendo sus tejidos, el cual es su mayor fuente de ingreso y la forma con que ayuda a su marido con los ingresos de la casa.
texts.en:
This group is called ”las tejedoras” and is from the city of Caacupé. Even if it is a large group, they get along very well and help each other, because they know that by cooperating, they will do things in a better way and will be able to help their families.

The group’s president, Mrs. Norma, lives together with her husband and children. She makes handicrafts in ñanduti (a special kind of hand-made knitting) and also sells clothes. Norma says that she wants to inculcate in her children the art of ñanduti, a beautiful art and cultural heritage.

Norma is requesting this loan to buy threads and different needles needed for knitting. This is her largest source of income and her way to help her husband with the expenses.

loans.use: to buy threads and needles.

loans.name: Yrysgul

texts.ru: Ырысгул 38 лет, замужем, имеет 5 детей. Ырысгул после развала СССР получила свою часть земли и начала занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Ырысгул,  Ырысгуль  на сегодняшний день имеет очень развитое хозяйство, ежемесячная прибыль от продажи молока составляет около 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Ырысгул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение домашней скотины. Доходы от кредита Ырысгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Yrysgul is 38 years old, married, and has five children. After the collapse of the USSR, Yrysgul received her own parcel of land and started to raise livestock. Through hard work, Yrysgul today has a highly developed farm, with a monthly income from the sale of milk of about 8,000 Som (KGS). 

With the goal of further developing her business, Yrysgul appealed to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 Som (KGS) to increase the number of domestic livestock. Yrysgul plans to invest income from the loan to further increase the number of domestic livestock.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru:
Шарофат  женщина  в возрасте 50 лет. Она замужем и имеет детей.  Шарофат  занимается производством лепешек.  Этот  бизнес у них семейный. Ей помогают муж, сын и невестка.  Не давно она поставила новый большой тандыр(национальная печь) и теперь каждый день они пекут по четыре мешков муки из которой получается около 1200 лепешек.   От этого прибыль и семейный бюджет у них увеличивается. Этот бизнес единственный доход в семье. Поэтому Шарофат старается развивать этот бизнес.
 На полученный кредит Шарофат планирует  закупить  оптом муку  и уголь на зиму.  Она заранее благодарит организацию Кива за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Sharofat is a woman of 50 years. She is married and has children. Sharofat is engaged in making flatbreads. This is a family business. She is helped by her husband, son, and daughter-in-law. 

Not long ago, she installed a big new tandoor (national oven) and now ever day they bake through four bags of flour which yields about 1,200 flatbreads. 

From these earnings, they also increase the family budget. This business is the only source of income for the family. Therefore Sharofat is trying to develop this business. 

Sharofat plans to use the received loan to buy wholesale flour and coal for the winter. She sends her thanks in advance to Kiva for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy flour and coal

loans.name: Hayfaa

texts.en:
Hayfaa is a 22-year-old single woman who has been selling electrical goods and and gifts since 2002. Hayfaa was only 12 years old when she started working to contribute to her family's income. She started her own business, and her wide experience in this domain helped her a lot in attracting good, loyal customers.

Hayfaa is applying for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to perform necessary maintenance and to decorate her shop in order to make it attractive to her customers and to organize her products in a well-managed way.

This is her second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, and she is in good standing with a good repayment history. Hayfaa is hoping to keep expanding her business by increasing the variety of products available.

loans.use: to make necessary maintenance to her shop

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 53 years old, married, and the mother of six children. She is a shop keeper in Mariakani. She has been in this business for the past two years and is doing great. Elizabeth has requested a loan to purchase additional stock for her shop, such as bales of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking fat. She will use the anticipated profit to open a cereal business. This will be her third loan, and the previous loans were repaid successfully. She hopes to have a successful family and business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock, such as wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking fat

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo is a 44-year-old married man with three children, ages 20, 18 and 10. For 15 years, he has been engaged in a motorcycle transportation business. This business is the source of his income and provides the family's daily needs. He earns 4000 PHP monthly. His wife is a food vendor. 

Leonardo is requesting a loan to buy tires, motorcycle oil, and gasoline. Through this loan, his motorcycle will be in good condition every time he uses it. In the future, Leonardo dreams of expanding their business and improving their lives. He wants to send his children to school to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy tires, motorcycle oil, and gasoline

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
María, 51 años de edad es una mujer  humilde ama de casa que a pesar de no haber culminado sus estudios a como ella hubiera deseado es una persona muy trabajadora con deseo de salir adelante, originaria de Managua, de oficio comerciante, su nivel académico es hasta el bachillerato, orgullosa madre de 3 hijos, tiene a su cargo, solo 1  hija de 11 años,  actualmente cursa sus estudios de secundaria, ella se dedica al negocio de venta de  ropa y zapatos desde hace 8 años. 
Inicio su actividad   con dinero propio que tenia ahorrado, anteriormente tenia una tienda  de ropa, pero se le quemo en el Municipio  San Carlos del Rio San Juan,  de su anterior negocio decide poner la venta de  pulpería en su casa de habitación, en su negocio recibe el apoyo de su hija que le ayuda económicamente, sus productos los comercializa  en la misma comunidad y  pulperías aledañas a la zona, se siente satisfecha con su negocio porque es mas rentable, cuenta con clientes fijos. 
Realiza el préstamo para comprar azúcar, frijoles, aceite, arroz, detergente, jabón, todos los insumos necesarios para surtir su pulpería, ella estima el crédito será de ayuda ya que podrá invertir en su negocio lo que permitirá la atracción de más clientes generando a la vez más ingresos,  sus planes futuros es hacerle mejoras a su casa y llegar a tener su carro, su meta próxima es ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
María, who is 51 years old, is a humble housekeeper that, although she never finished her studies as she would have liked to have done, is a very hard-working person with a desire to rise above her circumstances. She is originally from Managua, with a background in business, and she has her high school diploma. She is the proud mother of three children, only one of which she still has under her direct care; an 11-year-old daughter who is currently enrolled in middle school. She has been selling clothing and shoes for eight years. 

She began her business with money that she had personally saved. She had a clothing shop in the past, but it burned down in the municipality of San Carlos del Rio San Juan. Going off of her previous business, she decided to sell groceries from a spare room in her house, and she does receive some financial support from her daughter. Her products are sold within her own community and in the surrounding grocery stores in the area. She feels satisfied with her business because it is more profitable, and she can count on steady clients. 

She would like to use the loan to buy sugar, beans, oil, rice, detergent, soap, and other products necessary to outfit her grocery store. She would be very grateful for the loan, as it would be of great help to her further investment in her business and to attract more customers, generating at the same time more income. Her future plans include making repairs and improvements on her house and eventually buying a car, but her next goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, beans, oil, rice, detergent and soap.

loans.name: Sub Comision Vecinal De Agua Sector 6 Group

texts.es:
La comisión vecinal se fundó en el año 2006, Actualmente cuenta con  210 usuarios.  Se inicio con un grupo de vecinos que solicitaron apoyo de la municipalidad para la construcción de un pozo artesiano y el tanque para la comunidad.
La comisión cuenta con dos personas encargadas la Sra. María que se encarga de la cobranza y el Sr. Juan  encargado del tanque y de las cañerías.
Esta aguatería llamada Sub Comisión vecinal de Agua Sector 6 está ayudando a muchas personas a poder tener algo tan vital e importante como es el agua.
Juan y Maria solicitan este crédito para la compra de medidores para que a través de esto la gente pueda concienciarse del uso del Agua y así poder cuidar el medio ambiente y la utilización de nuestro recurso natural.
Gracias a este crédito la comisión podrá mejorar su servicio de agua potable para la comunidad y así poder llegar a más hogares con sus servicios.
texts.en:
The Comisión Vecinal was founded in the year 2006. It currently has 210 users. It began with a group of neighbors requesting help from the municipality for the construction of an artesian well and a tank for the community.

The Comisión has two caretakers. María is in charge of collecting payment and Juan handles the tank and pipelines.

The water tank facility, called Sub Comisión Vecinal de Agua Sector 6, is helping many people to be able to have something vital and important such as water. Juan and Maria are asking for this loan to buy gauges for measuring usage so that people can become aware of the use of water and thus be able to care for the environment and the use of our natural resources.

Thanks to this loan the Comisión could improve their drinkable water service for the community and thus be able reach more households with their services.

loans.use: to buy gauges for measuring water usage of the drinkable water from the community water tank

loans.name: Abdukayum

texts.ru: Абдукаюму 60 лет. Он женат на прекрасной женщине, с которой прожил много лет. Его жена пенсионерка и получает маленькую пенсию. Он имеет 3 детей. Его дети совершеннолетние. Абдукаюм не смотря на свой возраст, очень упорно работает. Уже более 10 лет он является отличным рыбаком. Каждое утро он рано встаёт и идет к морю с надеждой ловить рыбу и на этом прожить день. Он ловит примерно 20-25 кг рыбу в день и продает на местном рынке. Его сын помогает ему в этом деле. Они живут не далеко от моря и ему удобно рыболовство. Абдукаюм покупает продукты питания, одежду и другие не обходимые средства для проживания. Семья Абдукаюма довольна от такого заботливого отца и мужа. Однако год за годом здоровье Абдукаюма ухудшается. Он серьезно болен и ему срочно надо лечится. Абдукаюм  не имеет денег для лечения и поэтому обратился за займом в сумме 2000 сомони для покупки лекарств. Он ждет и надеется на вашу доброту. Он обещает погасить займ во время.
texts.en:
Abdukayum is 60 years old. He is married to a lovely woman, with whom he has lived for many years. His wife is retired and receives a small pension. They have three grown children. 

Despite his age, Abdukayum works very hard. For over ten years, he has been a great fisherman. Every morning he gets up early and goes to the sea with the hope to catch fish and in this way to live through the day. He catches primarily 20-25kg of fish per day and sells it at the local market. His son helps him in this work. They live not far from the sea and it is convenient for fishing. Abdukayum buys food, clothing, and other necessary means for living. Abdukayum's family is satisfied to have such a caring father and husband. 

But year after year Abdukayum's health is deteriorating. He is seriously ill and urgently needs treatment. Abdukayum has no money for treatment and therefore applied for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy medication. He is awaiting and hopes for your kindness. He promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy medicine for treatment

loans.name: Karomat

texts.ru:
Каромату 44 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Его муж очень добросовестный человек, который работает в Отделе Внутренних Дел. Каромат всегда мечтала иметь свой бизнес, и поэтому 2 года назад она начала свой бизнес скотоводством. 
Она имеет 2 коровы. У нее большой огород, где выращивает сено для скота. Она продает скот, за которым она присматривался в течение 15 дней. Она 2 раза перепродает скот в течение 1 месяца. На рынке у нее много клиентов. Она хочет построить стоило для скота, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  3000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов, чтобы построить стоило. Таким образом, она будет создать условию для  развития бизнеса. С полученного  дохода она собирается обеспечить своих детей хорошим образованием и современными технологиями. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Karomat is 44 years old. She is married and is raising three children. Her husband is a very conscientious person who worked in the Department of the Interior. Karomat always dreamed of having her own business, and so two years ago started her own cattle breeding business. 
 
She has two cows. She has a large garden where she grows hay for the cattle. She sells cattle that she watched over the course of 15 days. She sells cattle twice per month. The market has many customers. She wants to build a cowshed for the livestock, but does not have sufficient funds to do so. 

She is requesting a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy construction materials to build the cowshed. In this manner, she will create the conditions for business development. With the income received, she is going to provide their children with a good education and modern technology. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials for building a cowshed

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is 33 years old and sells shoes. He used his previous loan to buy shoes for resale. His business did well, and he managed to repay his loan. He has been selling shoes for three years, and Faulu Kenya has helped him stabilize his business through its financial support. Wilson is requesting a loan of 84,442 KES to increase his stock of shoes. He hopes to expand the shoe business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to increase his stock of shoes

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru:
Мавлюда сельская женщина в возрасте  30лет.  Замужем и имеет троих маленьких детей.  Живет с родителями мужа.    Они пенсионеры, а ее муж разнорабочий. 
   Мавлюда более семи лет держит дома скот и присматривает за ними и считает этот вид деятельности  очень хорошим и выгодным, так как её скот дает молоко и молочные продукты её семье. Иногда она продает молоко своим соседям. 
 Мавлюда  решила получить кредит и купить еще одну  дойную корову, так как сейчас очень много спроса на молочные изделия.  На полученный кредит Мавлюда купит корову и будет продавать на рынке молочные продукты и тем самым надеется улучшить свои условия жизни.  Мавлюда очень благодарна организации Кива за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Mavluda is a rural woman of 30 years. She is married and has three small children. She lives with her husband's parents. They are pensioners, and her husband does odd jobs. 

For more than seven years, Mavluda has been keeping and looking after domestic livestock and considers this a very good and beneficial activity as it provides milk and dairy products to her family. Sometimes she sells milk to the neighbors. 

Mavluda decided to take a loan and to buy another dairy cow, because now there is a lot of demand for dairy products. With the loan received, Mavluda is buying a cow and is going to sell dairy products at the market, and thus hopes to improve their living conditions. Mavluda is very grateful to Kiva for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Mirali

texts.ru: Мирали проживает в городе Дангара. Ему 26 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Мирали более семи лет занимается посевом сельскохозяйственных культур. Он в основном выращивает овощи. Мирали берет кредит для закупа семян, топлива и минеральных удобрений. Он намерен переработать имеющийся земельный участок а потом посеять овощи, чтобы получить хороший урожай для продажи.
texts.en:
Mirali lives in the town of Dangara. He is 26 years old, married, and has two children. For more than seven years, Mirali has been involved in rural agriculture. He mainly grows vegetables. 

Mirali is taking a loan to buy seeds, fuel, and mineral fertilizers. He intends to rework the existing land and then to plant vegetables in order to get a good harvest for sale.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fuel, and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Ismatulo

texts.ru:
Исматуло проживает в городе Сарбанд. Он женат. Ему 51 год. У него трое детей. Жена Исматуло домохозяйка. Его старший сын работает в одной корпорации. Он помогает своим родителям. 
Исматуло начал свою работу в 2006 году. На то время он арендовал торговую точку на рынке. Исматуло на протядении шести лет занимается торговлей продуктов питания. За это время он смог расширить свою деятельность. На сегодняшний день у Исматуло собственный продуктовый магазин рядом с домом. В торговле частично ему помогает его жена. 
Исматуло берет кредит с целью увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Ismatulo lives in the town of Sarband. He is married, 51 years old, and has three children. Ismatulo's wife is a homemaker. His eldest son works in a corporation. He helps his parents. 

Ismatulo began his own work in 2006. At that time, he leased a kiosk in the market. In the following six years, Ismatulo engaged in trade of food products. In this time, he was able to expand his activities. Today, Ismatulo has his own grocery store near his home. His wife helps him part-time in this work. 

Ismatulo is taking a loan with the goal of increasing sales.

loans.use: to buy products and household goods

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary's group is comprised of five hard-working women. Mary is 20 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki, in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is single and has two children, who are currently in school. For the past three years, Mary has been working hard to manage her small business. She sells cassava flour. 

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy cassava flour to resell, and will help Mary to generate greater profits. With her profits she will pay her children's school fees and the medical bills. Mary hopes that in the future she will be able to educate her children up to university. 

Mary is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to resell.

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.ru:
Мутабар женщина средних лет, мать троих детей,работает бухгалтером в государственном учреждении. Много лет проработала в бюджетной сфере. Ее муж  пенсионер и занимается частными работами. Мутабар очень старается чтобы его дети не нуждались не в чем.
  Мутабар  обратилась  организацию Кива  за помощью.   По национальным традициям у таджиков много обрядов и мероприятий, одно из которых мероприятие по поводу рождения внуков и  Мутабар как бабушка должна готовить много подарков и провести большое мероприятие.  Для этого таджики копят деньги, но на государственную зарплату отложить деньги невозможно.
  На полученный кредит Мутабар хочет купить подарки своему внуку и провести это мероприятие.  Она очень надеется на помощь и поддержку со стороны организации Кива и заранее благодарит.
texts.en:
Mutabar is a middle-aged woman, the mother of three children, and works as an accountant at a public institution. She has worked in the budgetary sphere for many years. Her husband is retired and is engaged in private work. Mutabar tries hard for her children not to be in need anything. 

Mutabar appealed to Kiva for help. According to national traditions, Tajiks have many ceremonies and events, one of which is the birth of a grandchild. As grandmother, Mutabar must prepare many gifts and put on a big event. To do this, Tajiks save money, but with a state salary it is not possible to save up much. 

With the loan received, Mutabar wants to buy gifts for her grandson and to host an event. She looks forward to the help and support from Kiva and sends her thanks in advance.

loans.use: to buy gifts for her grandson

loans.name: Abdusamad

texts.ru: Абдусамад житель района Бохтар. Он женатый 28 - летний молодой человек. Абдусамад является отцом троих детей. Он работает на рынке. Абдусамад предоставляет услугу на своем мотороллере. Это услуга считает недорогой. В этой области Абдусамад более года. Он берет кредит для приобретения еще одного мотороллера, так как зимой тяжело работать с одним из-за недостатка электроэнергии.
texts.en:
Abdusamad is a resident of the Bohtar region. He is a married, 28-year-old young man. Abdusamad is the father of three children. 

He works in the market. Abdusamad offers services with his scooter. This service is considered inexpensive. Abdusamad has been working in this area for more than a year. 

He is taking a loan to buy another scooter, as it is difficult in the winter to operate with only one due to a lack of electricity.

loans.use: to purchase a scooter to continue his work and in turn to use the scooter

loans.name: Alxan

texts.ru: Alxan is a single peson. He lives in the Fizuli region of Azerbaijan with his mother and father, but he was an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fizuli town. Alxan is 29 years old. He loves his work. Alxan has his butcher shop for 3 years. Now he needs 1,600 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) to buy sheeps to improve his business.
texts.en:
Alxan is single. He lives in the Fizuli region of Azerbaijan with his mother and father, but he is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fizuli town. Alxan is 29 years old. 

He loves his work. Alxan has had a butcher shop for three years. Now he needs 1,600 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) to buy sheep to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cloth for her sewing business

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is a 48-year-old married woman with five girls and three boys. She engaged in a hog-raising business six months ago. This is the source of her income. Her husband is a farmer. Her monthly income is 2,000 PHP.

Luzminda is requesting a loan to buy pigs, pellets and vitamins. Through this loan, she will be able to have other healthy pigs to sell.

Luzminda dreams of expanding her business in the future. She also wants to educate her children to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy pigs, pellets and vitamins.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes for her clothes-selling business.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a 43-year old-married woman with three children: two girls and one boy. She has been engaged in the food vending business, specifically barbecue, for two years now. This is where she gets her monthly income, which is 5,000 PHP. Her husband is a welder.

Salvacion is requesting a loan to buy sauce, pork meat and chicken meat for her business. Through this loan, she will be able to buy more stock of meat to make barbecue and sell it in her local community.

Salvacion dreams of expanding her business in the future and educating her children.

loans.use: to buy sauce, pork meat and chicken meat.

loans.name: Mariana Del Carmen

texts.es:
